verses.text: الر تِلْکَ‌ آيَاتُ‌ الْکِتَابِ‌ وَ قُرْآنٍ‌ مُبِينٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: الر ـ این [آیات بلندمرتبه] آیات کتاب الهی و آیات قرآنِ روشنگر [با عظمت] است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: الف، لام، را. اين است آيات كتاب و قرآن روشنگر.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: الف، لام، را. اين آيات كتاب و قرآن روشنگر است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: الف، لام، راء. اين است آيات كتاب [آسمانى‌] و قرآن روشنگر.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: الر (اسرار این حروف نزد خدا و رسول است) این است آیات کتاب خدا و قرآنی که (راه حق و باطل را) روشن و آشکار می‌گرداند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: الف. لام. را. این آیه‌های کتاب (منزّل آسمانی) و قرآن روشن (یزدانی) است. [[«الر»: (نگا: بقره / 1). «تِلْکَ»: آن. در اینجا به معنی این و اشاره به سوره مبارکه حجر است. «الْکِتَابِ»: مراد قرآن است که ذکر لفظ (قُرْآنٍ): بعد از آن عنوان تأکید را دارد. «مُبِینٍ»: روشن. روشنگر.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: الر الف لام راء این آیات کتاب آسمانی و قرآن مبین است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: الر، این آیات کتاب، و قرآن مبین است.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: این است آیتهای کتاب و قرآنی آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: الف، لام، را. اين است آيه‌هاى كتاب و قرآن روشن و روشن‌كننده.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: الر. آنهاست (تمامی‌) آیات کتاب (وحیانی) و قرآنی روشنگر.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: ALIF LAM RA. These are the verses of the Book and the perspicuous oration.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Alif-Lam-Ra; these are verses of the Book and the bright Qur’an.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Alif Lam Ra. Those are the signs of the Book and of a manifest Koran.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Alif. Lam. Ra. These are the verses of the Book, and a Qur'an luminous.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Alif-Lam-Ra. [These letters are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings]. These are the Verses of the Book, and a plain Quran.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the Verses of the Book; a Quran that makes things clear.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Alif. Lam. Ra'. These are the verses of the Book, and a Clear Qur'an.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Alif-Lam-Ra. These are Ayat of the Book and a plain Qur'an.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Alif. Lam. Ra. These are verses of the Scripture and a plain Reading.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the signs of the Book and a manifest Quran.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: AlifLaamRa. Those are the verses of the Book, the Clear Koran.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur'an.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Alif. Lam. Ra. These are the verses of the Book and the glorious Quran.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Alif Lam Ra. These are the verses of the Book and (of) a Quran that makes (things) clear.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Aliflamra tilka ayatu alkitabi waquranin mubeenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Alif Lam Ra. These are the verses of a clear Book, the Quran.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: A. L. R. These are the Ayats of Revelation,- of a Qur'an that makes things clear.

verses.text: رُبَمَا يَوَدُّ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا لَوْ کَانُوا مُسْلِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: کافران [هنگام روبرو شدن با عذاب] چه بسا آرزو می کنند که کاش تسلیم [فرمان های خدا] بودند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بسا كه كافران آرزو كنند كه اى‌كاش مسلمان مى‌بودند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: چه بسا كسانى كه كافر شدند آرزو مى‌كنند كه اى كاش مسلمان بودند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: چه بسا كسانى كه كافر شدند آرزو كنند كه كاش مسلمان بودند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: کافران (چون چشم حقیقت بین بگشایند) ای بسا آرزو کنند که کاش مسلم و خداپرست بودند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بارها و بارها کافران (در دنیای دیگر) آرزو می‌کنند که کاش! (در این جهان) مسلمان می‌بودند (و فرموده‌های خدا و رهنمودهای انبیاء را گردن می‌نهادند). [[«رُبَمَا»: چه بسا. این واژه برای تقلیل و تکثیر به کار می‌رود و در اینجا معنی تکثیر دارد. «یَوَدُّ»: دوست می‌دارند. آرزو می‌کنند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چه بسا کافران آرزو کنند که کاش مسلمان بودند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: کافران (هنگامی که آثار شوم اعمال خود را ببینند،) چه بسا آرزو می‌کنند که ای کاش مسلمان بودند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بسا دوست دارند آنان که کفر ورزیدند کاش می‌بودند مسلمانان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: چه بسا كسانى كه كافر شدند آرزو كنند كه كاش مسلمان بودند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: چه بسا کسانی که کافر شدند آرزو کنند کاش مسلمان بودند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The unbelievers would haply like to wish that they had submitted (and become Muslim).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The disbelievers will ardently wish that if only they had been Muslims! (At the time of death / in their graves / on the Day of Resurrection.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Perchance the unbelievers will wish that they had surrendered:

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Oft times would those who disbelieve fain that they had been Muslims.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Perhaps (often) will those who disbelieve wish that they were Muslims [those who have submitted themselves to Allah's Will in Islam Islamic Monotheism, this will be on the Day of Resurrection when they will see the disbelievers going to Hell and the Muslims going to Paradise].

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Perhaps those who disbelieve would like to become Muslims.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Soon will the time come when the unbelievers will wish they were Muslims.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: How much would those who disbelieved wish that they had been Muslims.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: It may be that those who disbelieve wish ardently that they were Muslims.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Much will the faithless wish that they had been Muslims.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It could be that those who disbelieve will wish that they were Muslims.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Perhaps those who disbelieve will wish that they had been Muslims.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: How strongly the unbelievers will wish that they had been Muslims.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Often will those who disbelieve wish that they had been Muslims.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Rubama yawaddu allatheena kafaroo law kanoo muslimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: A time will surely come when those who are bent on denying the truth will wish that they had surrendered themselves to God,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Again and again will those who disbelieve, wish that they had bowed (to Allah's will) in Islam.

verses.text: ذَرْهُمْ‌ يَأْکُلُوا وَ يَتَمَتَّعُوا وَ يُلْهِهِمُ‌ الْأَمَلُ‌ فَسَوْفَ‌ يَعْلَمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگذارشان تا بخورند و [با لذایذ مادی و زودگذر] کامرانی کنند، و آرزوها، سرگرمشان نماید؛ سپس [حقّانیّت اسلام و فرجام شوم خود را] خواهند فهمید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: واگذارشان تا بخورند و بهره‌ور شوند و آرزو به خود مشغولشان دارد، زودا كه خواهند دانست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آنها را بگذار تا بخورند و بهره‌گيرند و آرزوها سرگرمشان كند، ولى به زودى خواهند دانست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگذارشان تا بخورند و برخوردار شوند و آرزو[ها] سرگرمشان كند، پس به زودى خواهند دانست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (ای رسول ما) این کافران (لجوج) را واگذار تا به خورد و خواب طبیعت و لذات حیوانی سرگرم باشند و آمال و اوهام دنیوی آنان را غافل گرداند، پس (نتیجه این کامرانی بیهوده را) به زودی خواهند یافت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگذار بخورند و بهره‌ور شوند و آرزو آنان را غافل سازد. بالأخره خواهند دانست (که چه کار بدی کرده‌اند این که تنها به دنیا پرداخته‌اند و آخرت را فراموش نموده‌اند). [[«ذَرْهُمْ»: رهایشان ساز. بگذار که آنان. «یُلْهِهِمْ»: آنان را غافل سازد. ایشان را به خود مشغول کند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: رهایشان کن تا بخورند و بهره‌مند شوند، و آرزوها سرگرمشان بدارد، زودا که بدانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگذار آنها بخورند، و بهره گیرند، و آرزوها آنان را غافل سازد؛ ولی بزودی خواهند فهمید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگذارشان بخورند و کام روا دارند و سرگرمشان سازد آرزو پس زود است بدانند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: واگذارشان تا بخورند و برخوردار شوند و آرزو سرگرمشان كند، زودا كه بدانند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: واگذارشان (تا) بخورند و برخوردار شوند و آرزو(ی شیطانی) سرگرمشان کند. پس در آینده‌ای دور خواهند دانست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Leave them to feast and revel, beguiled by hope; they will come to know soon.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Leave them to eat and enjoy, and for aspiration to involve them in play – so they will shortly come to know.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: leave them to eat, and to take their joy, and to be bemused by hope; certainly they will soon know!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Leave them thou to eat and to enjoy, and let vain hope divert them; presently they will know.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Leave them to eat and enjoy, and let them be preoccupied with (false) hope. They will come to know!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Leave them to eat, and enjoy, and be lulled by hope. They will find out.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Leave them to eat and enjoy life and let false hopes amuse them. They will soon come to know.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Leave them to eat and enjoy, and let them be preoccupied with (false) hope. They will come to know!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Let them eat and enjoy life, and let (false) hope beguile them. They will come to know!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Leave them to eat and enjoy and to be diverted by longings. Soon they will know.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Let them eat and enjoy; and let their hopes deceive them, soon they shall know.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by [false] hope, for they are going to know.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), leave them alone to eat and enjoy themselves and let their desires deceive them; they will soon know (the Truth).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Leave them that they may eat and enjoy themselves and (that) hope may beguile them, for they will soon know.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Tharhum yakuloo wayatamattaAAoo wayulhihimu alamalu fasawfa yaAAlamoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: so leave them to eat and enjoy themselves and let them be beguiled by vain hopes; for soon they will realise [the truth].

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Leave them alone, to enjoy (the good things of this life) and to please themselves: let (false) hope amuse them: soon will knowledge (undeceive them).

verses.text: وَ مَا أَهْلَکْنَا مِنْ‌ قَرْيَةٍ إِلاَّ وَ لَهَا کِتَابٌ‌ مَعْلُومٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و هیچ شهری را [به خاطر فساد فراگیرش] نابود نکردیم مگر اینکه برای آن سرنوشتی معین [وروزگار ودوره ای تغییرناپذیر] بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هيچ قريه‌اى را هلاك نكرديم، مگر آنكه زمانى معلوم داشت.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و هيچ شهرى را هلاك نكرديم مگر اين كه براى آن اجلى معين بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و هيچ شهرى را هلاك نكرديم مگر اينكه براى آن اجلى معيّن بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما هیچ ملک و ملتی را هلاک نکردیم جز به هنگامی معین.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما هیچ شهر و روستائی را نابود نکرده‌ایم مگر (پس از انقضای) مدّت معیّنی (که) داشته است. [[«قَرْیَةٍ»: شهر. آبادی. مراد ساکنان آنجا نیز می‌تواند باشد. «کِتَابٌ»: به معنی مکتوب است، یعنی: واجب و مقدّر (نگا: آل‌عمران / 145).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ما [اهل‌] هیچ شهری را نابود نکردیم مگر آنکه اجل مکتوب و معینی داشت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما اهل هیچ شهر و دیاری را هلاک نکردیم مگر اینکه اجل معیّن (و زمان تغییر ناپذیری) داشتند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نابود نکردیم شهری را جز آنکه بود آن را کتابی دانسته‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و [مردم‌] هيچ شهرى را هلاك نكرديم مگر آنكه آن را نوشته‌اى- حكمى و سرنوشتى و زمانى- معلوم بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و هیچ گروهی را هلاک نکردیم مگر اینکه برایشان (سرنوشت و) نوشته‌ای معلوم است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Not one habitation have We destroyed but at the time determined for it.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And every dwelling that We destroyed, had a known decree for it.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Never a city have We destroyed, but it had a known decree,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We have not destroyed a town but there was therefor a decree known.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And never did We destroy a township but there was a known decree for it.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We have never destroyed a town unless it had a set time.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Whenever We destroyed a town, a definite term had previously been decreed for it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And never did We destroy a township but there was a known decree for it.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We destroyed no township but there was a known decree for it.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We did not destroy any town but that it had a known term.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We never destroyed a village whose term had not already been decreed.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We did not destroy any city but that for it was a known decree.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We never destroyed any town without pre-ordaining the fate of its people.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And never did We destroy a town but it had a term made known.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama ahlakna min qaryatin illa walaha kitabun maAAloomun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have never destroyed a township without a definite decree having been issued;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Never did We destroy a population that had not a term decreed and assigned beforehand.

verses.text: مَا تَسْبِقُ‌ مِنْ‌ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَ مَا يَسْتَأْخِرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: هیچ ملتی از اجل معین خود نه پیش می افتد و نه پس می ماند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هيچ امتى از اجل خويش نه پيش مى‌افتد و نه پس مى‌ماند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: هيچ امتى از اجل خويش نه پيش مى‌افتد و نه پس مى‌ماند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: هيچ امتى از اجل خويش نه پيش مى‌افتد و نه پس مى‌ماند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: هیچ قومی از اجل خود (از آنچه در علم حق معین است یک لحظه) پس و پیش نخواهند افتاد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هیچ ملّتی بر (مدّت معیّن و سررسید) اجل خود پیشی نمی‌گیرد و از آن عقب نمی‌افتد. [[«أُمَّةٍ»: دسته. گروه. ملّت. «مِنْ أُمَّةٍ»: حرف (مِنْ) زائد و (أُمَّةٍ) فاعل است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: هیچ امتی از اجلش پیش و پس نیفتد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هیچ گروهی از اجل خود پیشی نمی‌گیرد؛ و از آن عقب نخواهد افتاد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نه پیشی گیرد امّتی سرآمد خویش را و نه پس افتد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هيچ امتى از سرآمد خود نه پيشى گيرد و نه واپس افتد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: هیچ امتی ازسرنوشت خویش نه پیشی می‌گیرد ونه (از آن) تأخیر می‌جوید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: No people can hasten or delay the term already fixed for them.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: No group may advance its appointed promise nor postpone it.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and no nation outstrips its term, nor do they put it back.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: No community precedeth the term thereof nor doth it fall behind.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: No nation can anticipate its term, nor delay it.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: No nation can bring its time forward, nor can they delay it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: No people can outstrip the term for its destruction nor can it delay it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: No nation can advance its term, nor delay it.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: No nation can outstrip its term nor can they lag behind.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: No nation can advance its time nor can it defer it.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: No nation can outstrip its term, nor do they put it back.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: No nation will precede its term, nor will they remain thereafter.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Every nation can only live for the time appointed for it.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: No people can hasten on their doom nor can they postpone (it).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ma tasbiqu min ommatin ajalaha wama yastakhiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: no people can forestall their doom, nor can they delay it.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Neither can a people anticipate its term, nor delay it.

verses.text: وَ قَالُوا يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِي‌ نُزِّلَ‌ عَلَيْهِ‌ الذِّکْرُ إِنَّکَ‌ لَمَجْنُونٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و گفتند: ای کسی که قرآن بر او نازل شده! قطعاً تو دیوانه ای!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و گفتند: اى مردى كه قرآن بر تو نازل شده، حقا كه تو ديوانه‌اى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و گفتند: اى كسى كه قرآن بر او نازل شده، تو به يقين ديوانه‌اى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و گفتند: «اى كسى كه قرآن بر او نازل شده است، به يقين تو ديوانه‌اى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و کافران گفتند: ای کسی که (مدعی آنی که) قرآن از جانب خدا بر تو نازل شده تو (به عقیده ما) محققا دیوانه‌ای.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و (تمسخرکنان) می‌گویند: ای کسی که (گمان می‌بری از آسمان) قرآن بر تو نازل گشته است، تو حتماً دیوانه‌ای! [[«الذِّکْرُ»: مصدر است و به معنی اسم فاعل، یعنی (مذکّر) است. یعنی: کتاب یادآور و اندرزگو که قرآن است (نگا: آل‌عمران / 58، نحل / 43 و 44). «نُزِّلَ عَلَیْهِ الذِّکْرُ»: مراد تمسخر و استهزاء است (نگا: منافقون / 1و 7).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و گفتند ای کسی که قرآن بر او نازل شده است، به یقین تو دیوانه‌ای‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و گفتند: «ای کسی که «ذکر» [= قرآن‌] بر او نازل شده، مسلماً تو دیوانه‌ای!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گفتند ای آنکه فرود آورده شده است بر او قرآن همانا توئی دیوانه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و گفتند: اى آن كسى كه قرآن بر او فرو آمده، همانا تو ديوانه‌اى

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و گفتند: «ای کسی که قرآن بر او نازل شده است! همانا تو بی‌گمان دیوانه‌ای!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And yet they say: "You, to whom this Exposition has been sent are surely possessed of the Devil.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they said, “O you upon whom the Qur’an has been sent, you are indeed insane.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They say: 'Thou, upon whom the Remembrance is sent down, thou art assuredly possessed!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they say: O thou unto whom the Admonition hath been sent down! verily thou art possessed.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they say: "O you (Muhammad SAW) to whom the Dhikr (the Quran) has been sent down! Verily, you are a mad man.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And they said, “O you who received the message, you are insane.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They say: "O you to whom the Admonition has been revealed, you are surely crazed.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they say: "O you (Muhammad) to whom the Dhikr (the Qur'an) has been revealed! Verily, you are a madman!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they say: O thou unto whom the Reminder is revealed, lo! thou art indeed a madman!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They said, ‘O you, to whom the Reminder has been sent down, you are indeed crazy.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They say: 'You to whom the Remembrance is sent down, you are indeed mad.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they say, "O you upon whom the message has been sent down, indeed you are mad.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (The unbelievers have said), "You to whom the Quran has been revealed are insane.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they say: O you to whom the Reminder has been revealed! you are most surely insane:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqaloo ya ayyuha allathee nuzzila AAalayhi alththikru innaka lamajnoonun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They say, "You to whom the Reminder [the Quran] has been sent down, you are surely possessed.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They say: "O thou to whom the Message is being revealed! truly thou art mad (or possessed)!

verses.text: لَوْ مَا تَأْتِينَا بِالْمَلاَئِکَةِ إِنْ‌ کُنْتَ‌ مِنَ‌ الصَّادِقِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: اگر [درباره پیامبری ات] راست می گویی، چرا فرشتگان را نزد ما نمی آوری؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر راست مى‌گويى، چرا فرشتگان را براى ما نمى‌آورى؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اگر راست مى‌گويى چرا فرشته‌ها را نزد ما نمى‌آورى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اگر راست مى‌گويى چرا فرشته‌ها را پيش ما نمى‌آورى؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اگر راست می‌گویی (و بر تو فرشتگان خدا نازل می‌شوند) چرا فرشتگان را نزد ما نمی‌آری؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تو اگر از زمره‌ی راستگویانی، چرا (به جای آوردن قرآن) فرشتگان را به پیش ما نمی‌آوری (تا بر پیغمبری تو گواهی دهند؟!). [[«لَوْ ما»: چرا که نه. واژه‌ای است که بر طلب حصول ما بعد خود دلالت دارد. مانند (لَوْ لا) است در (منافقون / 10).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اگر راست می‌گویی چرا فرشتگان را برای ما نمی‌آوری؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اگر راست می‌گویی، چرا فرشتگان را نزد ما نمی‌زوری؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: چرا نیاوری ما را به فرشتگان اگر هستی از راستگویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اگر راست مى‌گويى، چرا فرشتگان را نزد ما نمى‌آرى؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «اگر از راستان بوده‌ای چرا فرشته‌ها را پیش ما نمی‌آوری‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: If you are a man of truth, why can't you bring the angels to us?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Why do you not bring angels to us, if you are truthful?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Why dost thou not bring the angels unto us, if thou speakest truly?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Why bringest thou not angels unto us if thou art of the truthtellers!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Why do you not bring angels to us if you are of the truthful ones?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you are truthful?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Why do you not bring down angels upon us if you are indeed truthful?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Why do you not bring angels to us if you are of the truthful"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Why bringest thou not angels unto us, if thou art of the truthful?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Why do you not bring us the angels should you be truthful?!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Why do you not bring down the angels, if what you say is true'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you should be among the truthful?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Why do you not bring down the angels if what you say is true".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Why do you not bring to us the angels if you are of the truthful ones?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Law ma tateena bialmalaikati in kunta mina alssadiqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Why do you not bring down the angels upon us, if you are truthful?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Why bringest thou not angels to us if it be that thou hast the Truth?"

verses.text: مَا نُنَزِّلُ‌ الْمَلاَئِکَةَ إِلاَّ بِالْحَقِ‌ وَ مَا کَانُوا إِذاً مُنْظَرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [اینان بدانند که] ما فرشتگان را جز به درستی و راستی نازل نمی کنیم، و در آن هنگام [که نازل شوند، این منکران لجوج از دچار شدن به عذاب] مهلت نمی یابند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما فرشتگان را جز به حق نازل نمى‌كنيم و در آن هنگام ديگر مهلتشان ندهند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: ما فرشتگان را جز به حق نمى‌فرستيم و در آن هنگام ديگر مهلت داده نمى‌شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: فرشتگان را جز به حق فرو نمى‌فرستيم، و در آن هنگام، ديگر مهلت نيابند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما فرشتگان را جز به حق (و حکمت و مصلحت) نمی‌فرستیم، و آن گاه که بفرستیم دیگر کافران مهلتی نخواهند یافت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما فرشتگان را جز به حق و به همراه حق نازل نمی‌کنیم و هنگامی که نازل شوند (اگر بدانان ایمان نیاورند) دیگر بدیشان مهلت داده نمی‌شود (و فوراً عذاب الهی گریبانگیرشان می‌گردد و مجال ماندن نخواهند داشت). [[«بِالْحَقِّ»: به حق. همراه با حق ثابتی که قابل انکار نیست. به همراه عذاب. «مُنظَرِینَ»: مهلت داده‌شدگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [باید بدانند که‌] ما فرشتگان را جز به حق نازل نمی‌کنیم، و در آن صورت هم [که نازل کنیم‌] مهلت نخواهند یافت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (امّا اینها باید بدانند) ما فرشتگان را، جز بحق، نازل نمی‌کنیم،؛ و هرگاه نازل شوند، دیگر به اینها مهلت داده نمی‌شود (؛ و در صورت انکار، به عذاب الهی نابود می‌گردند)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نمی‌فرستیم فرشتگان را جز به حقّ و نیستند در آن هنگام مهلت‌دادگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: ما فرشتگان را جز بحق فرو نفرستيم، و آنگاه ديگر [اين كافران‌] مهلت نيابند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: فرشتگان را جز به حق فرو نفرستیم، و در آن هنگام (و هنگامه) مهلت‌یافته نبوده‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But then We never send the angels down save with the purpose (of enforcing their doom), after which they will not be given more respite.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We do not send down angels without reason, and if the angels descend they would not get any respite!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We send not down the angels, save with truth;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: We send not the angels down save with judgment, and then they would not be respited.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: We send not the angels down except with the truth (i.e. for torment, etc.), and in that case, they (the disbelievers) would have no respite!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We do not send the angels down except with reason, and they will not be held back.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We do not send down the angels (in frivolity); and when We do send them down, We do so with Truth; then people are granted no respite.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: We do not send the angels down except with the truth, and in that case, they (the disbelievers) would have no respite!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We send not down the angels save with the Fact, and in that case (the disbelievers) would not be tolerated.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We do not send down the angels except with due reason, and then they will not be granted any respite.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We do not send angels except with the truth. Then they shall have no respite.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: We do not send down the angels except with truth; and the disbelievers would not then be reprieved.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We do not send down angels except for a genuine purpose, at which time none will be given any further respite.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: We do not send the angels but with truth, and then they would not be respited.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ma nunazzilu almalaikata illa bialhaqqi wama kanoo ithan munthareena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But We send down the angels only to bring justice and then they will not be reprieved.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: We send not the angels down except for just cause: if they came (to the ungodly), behold! no respite would they have!

verses.text: إِنَّا نَحْنُ‌ نَزَّلْنَا الذِّکْرَ وَ إِنَّا لَهُ‌ لَحَافِظُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: همانا ما قرآن را نازل کردیم، و یقیناً ما نگهبان آن [از تحریف و زوال] هستیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما قرآن را خود نازل كرده‌ايم و خود نگهبانش هستيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بى‌ترديد ما خود اين قرآن را نازل كرديم و قطعا ما خود نگهدار آنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بى‌ترديد، ما اين قرآن را به تدريج نازل كرده‌ايم، و قطعاً نگهبان آن خواهيم بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: البته ما قرآن را بر تو نازل کردیم و ما هم آن را محققا محفوظ خواهیم داشت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما خود قرآن را فرستاده‌ایم و خود ما پاسدار آن می‌باشیم (و تا روز رستاخیز آن را از دستبرد دشمنان و از هرگونه تغییر و تبدیل زمان محفوظ و مصون می‌داریم). [[«إِنّا نَحْنُ ...»: این آیه دست کم با چهار تأکید لفظی بیانگر مصون ماندن قرآن از تحریف است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: همانا ما قرآن را نازل کرده‌ایم و ما خود نگهبان آنیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما قرآن را نازل کردیم؛ و ما بطور قطع نگهدار آنیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا ما فرستادیم قرآن را و همانا مائیم مر آن را نگهدارندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا ما اين ذكر- ياد و پند قرآن- را فرو فرستاديم، و هر آينه ما نگاهدار آنيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ما بی‌گمان، (همین) ما (این) یادواره [:قرآن] را به تدریج نازل کردیم و بی‌چون ما برای آن -به‌راستی- نگهبانانیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We have sent down this Exposition, and We will guard it.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed We have sent down the Qur’an, and indeed We Ourselves surely are its Guardians. (This is one of the miracles of the Qur’an – no one has been able to change even one letter of its text, despite every effort. It has remained in its original form since the 6th Century (A. D) and will remain so forever. Other Holy Books such as the Torah and the Bible have lost their originality.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then they would not be respited. It is We who have sent down the Remembrance, and We watch over it.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily We! it is We who have revealed the Admonition, and verily We are the guardians thereof.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily We: It is We Who have sent down the Dhikr (i.e. the Quran) and surely, We will guard it (from corruption).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Surely We revealed the Message, and We will surely preserve it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: As for the Admonition, indeed it is We Who have revealed it and it is indeed We Who are its guardians.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, We, it is We Who revealed the Dhikr (i.e. the Qur'an) and surely We will guard it (from corruption).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! We, even We, reveal the Reminder, and lo! We verily are its Guardian.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed We have sent down the Reminder, and indeed We will preserve it.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It is We who sent down the Koran, and We watch over it.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We Ourselves have revealed the Quran and We are its Protectors.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely We have revealed the Reminder and We will most surely be its guardian.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna nahnu nazzalna alththikra wainna lahu lahafithoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: It is We who have sent down the Reminder and We will, most surely, safeguard it.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: We have, without doubt, sent down the Message; and We will assuredly guard it (from corruption).

verses.text: وَ لَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِنْ‌ قَبْلِکَ‌ فِي‌ شِيَعِ‌ الْأَوَّلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بی تردید ما پیش از تو هم پیامبرانی را در امت های پیشین فرستادیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و ما رسولان خود را پيش از تو به ميان اقوام پيشين فرستاده‌ايم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و البته، پيش از تو نيز در ميان گروه‌هاى پيشينيان [پيامبرانى‌] فرستاديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و به يقين، پيش از تو [نيز] در گروههاى پيشينيان [پيامبرانى‌] فرستاديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما پیش از تو هم رسولانی بر امم سالفه فرستادیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما پیش از تو (پیغمبرانی را) به میان گروهها و دسته‌های پیشین روانه کرده‌ایم. [[«شِیَعِ»: جمع شیعه، گروهها و دسته‌های پیرو یک راه و رسم (نگا: أنعام / 65). «شِیَعِ الأوَّلِینَ»: اضافه موصوف به صفت است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به راستی پیش از تو [پیامبرانی‌] به میان امتهای نخستین فرستاده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما پیش از تو (نیز) پیامبرانی در میان امّتهای نخستین فرستادیم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا فرستادیم پیش از تو در توده‌های پیشینیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه پيش از تو [فرستادگان خود را] در ميان گروه‌هاى پيشين فرستاديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به‌راستی و درستی، ما پیش از تو (نیز پیامبرانی) فرستادیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We had also sent apostles to people of earlier persuasions.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed We sent Noble Messengers before you, to the former nations.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Indeed, We sent Messengers before thee, among the factions of the ancients,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And assuredly We have sent apostles before thee among the sects of the ancients.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Indeed, We sent Messengers before you (O Muhammad SAW) amongst the sects (communities) of old.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We sent others before you, to the former communities.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (O Muhammad), certainly We did send Messengers before you among the nations which have gone by.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Indeed, We sent (Messengers) before you (O Muhammad) amongst the earlier communities.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We verily sent (messengers) before thee among the factions of the men of old.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Certainly We sent [apostles] before you to former communities,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We have sent forth before you Messengers among the factions of the ancients.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We had certainly sent [messengers] before you, [O Muhammad], among the sects of the former peoples.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We sent Messengers to the ancient people who lived before you.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And certainly We sent (apostles) before you among the nations of yore.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaqad arsalna min qablika fee shiyaAAi alawwaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We sent messengers before you to the previous peoples,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: We did send messengers before thee amongst the religious sects of old:

verses.text: وَ مَا يَأْتِيهِمْ‌ مِنْ‌ رَسُولٍ‌ إِلاَّ کَانُوا بِهِ‌ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و هیچ پیامبری به سوی آنان نمی آمد مگر آنکه او را مسخره می کردند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هيچ پيامبرى بر آنها مبعوث نشد، جز آنكه مسخره‌اش كردند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و هيچ پيامبرى برايشان نمى‌آمد جز آن كه او را مسخره مى‌كردند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و هيچ پيامبرى برايشان نيامد جز آنكه او را به مسخره مى‌گرفتند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هیچ رسولی بر آن مردم نمی‌آمد جز آنکه به استهزای او می‌پرداختند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هیچ فرستاده‌ای به پیش ایشان نمی‌آمد مگر این که او را مسخره می‌کردند (همان گونه که هم اینک باطلگرایان تو را مسخره می‌دارند). [[«مِن رَّسُولٍ»: حرف (مِنْ) زائد و (رَسُولٍ) فاعل است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و هیچ پیامبری برای آنان نیامد مگر آنکه او را ریشخند می‌کردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هیچ پیامبری به سراغ آنها نمی‌آمد مگر اینکه او را مسخره می‌کردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نیامدشان فرستاده‌ای جز آنکه بودند بدو استهزاءکنندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هيچ فرستاده‌اى نمى‌آمدشان مگر آنكه او را استهزاء مى‌كردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و هیچ پیامبری ایشان را نیاید جز آنکه او را به مسخره می‌گرفته‌اند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But never once an apostle came to them at whom they did not scoff.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And never does a Noble Messenger come to them, but they mock at him.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and not a single Messenger came to them, but they mocked at him;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And not an apostle came unto them but at him they were wont to mock.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And never came a Messenger to them but they did mock him.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But no messenger came to them, but they ridiculed him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And whenever a Messenger came to them, they never failed to mock him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And there never came a Messenger to them but that they mocked him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And never came there unto them a messenger but they did mock him.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and there did not come to them any apostle but that they used to deride him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But no Messenger came to them except he was mocked.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And no messenger would come to them except that they ridiculed him.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: No Messenger went to them whom they did not mock.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And there never came an apostle to them but they mocked him.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama yateehim min rasoolin illa kanoo bihi yastahzioona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but there was never a messenger who came to them but they mocked him:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But never came a messenger to them but they mocked him.

verses.text: کَذٰلِکَ‌ نَسْلُکُهُ فِي‌ قُلُوبِ‌ الْمُجْرِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: ما این گونه [که قابل فهمیدن باشد] قرآن را وارد قلوب بدکاران می کنیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: راهش را در دل مجرمان اينچنين مى‌گشاييم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بدين‌سان آن [قرآن‌] را در دل‌هاى مجرمان راه مى‌دهيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بدين گونه آن [استهزا] را در دل بزهكاران راه مى‌دهيم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این گونه ما قرآن را (روشن) در دل زشتکاران وارد سازیم،

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما این گونه قرآن را به دلهای بزهکاران داخل می‌گردانیم (و از حق آنان را می‌آگاهانیم، تا برایشان اتمام حجّت شود). [[«نَسْلُکُهُ»: آن را وارد می‌گردانیم. مرجع ضمیر (ه) واژه (الذِّکْرَ) است (نگا: حجر / 13، شعراء / 200 و 201).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بدین‌سان آن را در دل گناهکاران راه می‌دهیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما اینچنین (و از هر طریق ممکن) قرآن را به درون دلهای مجرمان راه می‌دهیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بدینسان بمیرانیمش در دلهای گنهکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اينچنين آن

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: این گونه آن (استهزا) را در دل بزهکاران بسی نفوذ می‌دهیم (که خلاصی از آن ندارند).

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We place in the hearts of sinners (disbelief).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: This is how We make the mocking* enter the hearts of the guilty. (* The acts of disbelief.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: even so We cause it to enter into the hearts of the sinners --

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Even so we make a way for it in the hearts of the culprits.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Thus do We let it (polytheism and disbelief) enter into the hearts of the Mujrimun [criminals, polytheists, pagans, etc. (because of their mockery at the Messengers)].

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Thus We slip it into the hearts of the guilty.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Even so We make a way for it (that is, the Admonition) in the hearts of the culprits (like a hot rod);

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Thus We allow it to enter the hearts of the guilty.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thus do We make it traverse the hearts of the guilty:

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: That is how We let it pass through the hearts of the guilty:

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So We make it enter the hearts of the sinners.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Thus do We insert denial into the hearts of the criminals.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: This is how We cause the hearts of the guilty ones to behave.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Thus do We make it to enter into the hearts of the guilty;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kathalika naslukuhu fee quloobi almujrimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: thus We cause this [habit of mocking] to enter into the hearts of the sinful.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Even so do we let it creep into the hearts of the sinners -

verses.text: لاَ يُؤْمِنُونَ‌ بِهِ‌ وَ قَدْ خَلَتْ‌ سُنَّةُ الْأَوَّلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [با این همه] به آن ایمان نمی آورند، و البته روش پیشینیان هم [در مسخره کردن آیات خدا و استهزای پیامبران] به همین صورت بوده است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به آن ايمان نمى‌آورند و سنت پيشينيان چنين بوده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [با اين حال‌] به آن ايمان نمى‌آورند، و روش پيشينيان نيز [بر اين‌] رفته است [كه پيامبران را تكذيب مى‌كردند]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [كه‌] به او ايمان نمى‌آورند، و راه [و رسم‌] پيشينيان پيوسته چنين بوده است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: لیکن به آن ایمان نمی‌آورند، و البته عادت امم سابقه هم (مانند امت تو بر همین انکار و استهزا نسبت به رسولان و کتب آسمانی) گذشت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان بدان ایمان نمی‌آورند (چون در شهوات غوطه‌ورند و باطلگرایند نه حقّگرا) و شیوه‌ی اقوام پیشین هم بر این بوده است. [[«وَ قَدْ خَلَتْ ...»: شیوه اقوام پیشین نیز چنین بوده است. شیوه خدا درباره پیشینیان هم بر این بوده است که آنان را مدّت زمانی مهلت داده است و سپس نابودشان ساخته و به عذاب دردناک گرفتارشان نموده است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [که‌] به آن ایمان نمی‌آورند، و سنت پیشینیان [نیز چنین‌] گذشته است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (اما با این حال،) آنها به آن ایمان نمی‌آورند؛ روش اقوام پیشین نیز چنین بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: ایمان نیارند بدان حالی که گذشت آئین پیشینیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [و حال آنكه‌] به آن ايمان نمى‌آورند، و آيين و روش پيشينيان [بر اين‌] رفته است [كه پيامبران را تكذيب و نعمت خداوند را ناسپاسى كنند].

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بدان ایمان نمی‌آورند، و راه و رسم پیشینیان پیوسته چنان بوده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So, they will not believe in it: The example of former people is there.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They do not believe in him, and the tradition of earlier nations has passed.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: they believe not in it, though the wont of the ancients is already gone.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They believe not therein, and already the example of the ancients hath gone forth.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They would not believe in it (the Quran), and already the example of (Allah's punishment of) the ancients (who disbelieved) has gone forth.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They do not believe in it, though the ways of the ancients have passed away.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: they do not believe in it. This has been the wont of people of this kind from ancient times.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They would not believe in it (the Qur'an); and already the example of the ancients has gone forth.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They believe not therein, though the example of the men of old hath gone before.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: they do not believe in it, and the precedent of the ancients has already passed.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They do not believe in it even though the practice of the ancients has already gone.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They will not believe in it, while there has already occurred the precedent of the former peoples.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They do not believe in the Truth and they exactly follow the tradition of the ancient (unbelievers)

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They do not believe in it, and indeed the example of the former people has already passed.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: La yuminoona bihi waqad khalat sunnatu alawwaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They will not believe in it, though they have before them the example of former peoples,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: That they should not believe in the (Message); but the ways of the ancients have passed away.

verses.text: وَ لَوْ فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ‌ بَاباً مِنَ‌ السَّمَاءِ فَظَلُّوا فِيهِ‌ يَعْرُجُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اگر [برای دریافت حقایق ومعارف] دری از آسمان به روی آنان بگشاییم، که همواره از آن بالا روند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر بر ايشان از آسمان درى بگشاييم كه از آن بالا روند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اگر درى از آسمان بر آنان مى‌گشوديم كه در آن پيوسته بالا مى‌رفتند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اگر درى از آسمان بر آنان مى‌گشوديم كه همواره از آن بالا مى‌رفتند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اگر ما بر این کافران امتت دری از آسمان بگشاییم تا دائم بر آسمانها عروج (یا فرشتگان بر آنها نزول) کنند،

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر (به فرض) دری از آسمان به روی آنان بگشائیم و ایشان از آنجا شروع به بالا رفتن کنند (و فرشتگان و شگفتیهای جهان بالا را با چشم خود ببینند). [[«فَظَلُّوا فیهِ یَعْرُجُونَ»: از آنجا شروع به بالا رفتن کنند. یعنی مرتّباً به آسمان صعود و نزول داشته باشند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اگر بر آنان دری از [درهای‌] آسمان می‌گشودیم و آنان به آن عروج می‌کردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اگر دری از آسمان به روی آنان بگشاییم، و آنها پیوسته در آن بالا روند...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اگر بگشائیم بر ایشان دری را از آسمان پس آغاز کنند در آن بالا روند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اگر درى از آسمان بر آنان بگشاييم تا پيوسته در آن بالا روند [و قدرت و معجزات ما را بنگرند]،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اگر دری از آسمان بر آنان برگشاییم پس همواره در آن بالا روند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Even if We open a door in the heavens and they ascend through it in broad daylight,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And if We open for them a gate in the heavens, to ascend it through the day –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Though We opened to them a gate in heaven, and still they mounted through it,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And if We opened upon them a door of the heaven, and they passed the day mounting thereto.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And even if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they were to continue ascending thereto,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Even if We opened for them a gateway into the sky, and they began to ascend through it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: If We were even to open for them a way to the heavens, and they could continually climb up to it in broad daylight,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And even if We opened to them a gate to the heavens and they were to continue ascending through it (all day long).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And even if We opened unto them a gate of heaven and they kept mounting through it,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Were We to open for them a gate of the sky, so that they could go on ascending through it,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: If We opened a gate in the heaven and they kept ascending through it,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [even] if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continued therein to ascend,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Had We opened a door for them in the sky through which they could easily pass,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And even if We open to them a gateway of heaven, so that they ascend into it all the while,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaw fatahna AAalayhim baban mina alssamai fathalloo feehi yaAArujoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and even if We opened to them a door from heaven, and they began ascending through it,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Even if We opened out to them a gate from heaven, and they were to continue (all day) ascending therein,

verses.text: لَقَالُوا إِنَّمَا سُکِّرَتْ‌ أَبْصَارُنَا بَلْ‌ نَحْنُ‌ قَوْمٌ‌ مَسْحُورُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: باز خواهند گفت: یقیناً ما چشم بندی شده ایم، بلکه گروهی جادو شده هستیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گويند: چشمان ما را جادو كرده‌اند، بلكه ما مردمى جادوزده هستيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: قطعا مى‌گفتند: جز اين نيست كه ما چشم‌بندى شده‌ايم، بلكه ما گروهى جادو زده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: قطعاً مى‌گفتند: «در حقيقت، ما چشم‌بندى شده‌ايم، بلكه ما مردمى هستيم كه افسون شده‌ايم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باز هم خواهند گفت: چشمان ما را فرو بسته‌اند، بلکه در ما سحر و جادویی به کار برده‌اند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بی‌گمان خواهند گفت: حتماً ما را چشم‌بندی کرده‌اند (و آنچه می‌بینیم ابداً واقعیّت ندارد!) و بلکه ما را جادو نموده‌اند (این است که چیزها را عوضی می‌بینیم). [[«سُکِّرَتْ»: پوشانده شده است. از دیدن باز داشته شده است. پرده‌ای به پیش چشمانمان داشته شده است. «مَسْحُورُونَ»: سحر و جادوشدگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: باز بی‌شبهه می‌گفتند ما فقط چشم‌بندی شده‌ایم، بلکه قومی جادوزده هستیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: باز می‌گویند: «ما را چشم‌بندی کرده‌اند؛ بلکه ما (سر تا پا) سحر شده‌ایم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هر آینه گویند جز این نیست که چشم‌بند شدیم بلکه مائیم گروهی جادوشدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هر آينه گويند: چشمان ما را پوششى بر نهاده‌اند- ما را چشم‌بندى كرده‌اند-، بلكه ما گروهى جادوزده‌ايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بی‌گمان گویند: «در حقیقت، ما چشم‌بندی شده‌ایم، بلکه ما گروهی افسون‌شده‌ایم!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They will say all the same: "Our eyes were dazed (and clouded over). We were a people ensorcelled."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Even then they would say, “Our sights have been hypnotised – in fact, a magic spell has been cast upon us.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: yet would they say, 'Our eyes have been dazzled; nay, we are a people bewitched!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They would surely say: intoxicated have been our sights; aye! we are a people enchanted.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They would surely say: "Our eyes have been (as if) dazzled. Nay, we are a people bewitched."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They would still say, “Our eyes are hallucinating; in fact, we are people bewitched.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: they would still have said: "Surely our eyes have been dazzled; rather, we have been enchanted."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They would surely say (in the evening): "Our eyes have been (as if) dazzled (we have not seen any angel or heaven). Nay, we are a people bewitched."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They would say: Our sight is wrong - nay, but we are folk bewitched.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: they would surely say, ‘Indeed a spell has been cast on our eyes; indeed, we are a bewitched lot.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: still they would say: 'Our eyes were dazzled; truly, we must have been a bewitched people'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They would say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: they would have said, "Our eyes are bewildered and we have been affected by magic."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They would certainly say: Only our eyes have been covered over, rather we are an enchanted people.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Laqaloo innama sukkirat absaruna bal nahnu qawmun mashooroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: they would still say, "Our eyes have been dazzled. We are bewitched."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They would only say: "Our eyes have been intoxicated: Nay, we have been bewitched by sorcery."

verses.text: وَ لَقَدْ جَعَلْنَا فِي‌ السَّمَاءِ بُرُوجاً وَ زَيَّنَّاهَا لِلنَّاظِرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به راستی که ما در آسمان، برج هایی قرار دادیم و آن را برای بینندگان [به شکل صورت های فلکی] آراستیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و هرآينه در آسمان برجهايى آفريديم و براى بينندگانشان بياراستيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و همانا ما در آسمان برج‌هايى قرار داديم و آن را براى تماشاگران آراستيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و به يقين، ما در آسمان بُرجهايى قرار داديم و آن را براى تماشاگران آراستيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و همانا ما در آسمان کاخهای بلند برافراشتیم و بر چشم بینایان عالم آن کاخها را به زیب و زیور بیاراستیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما در آسمان برجهای نجومی پدید آورده‌ایم (که تقویمِ مجسّم جهان و بیانگر نظام شگرف و حساب دقیق آن است) و آن را برای بینندگان آراسته‌ایم (تا از این منظره‌ی زیبای بالا به قدرت آفریدگار تعالی پی ببرند). [[«بُرُوجاً»: منزلگاههائی که افلاک و کواکب در آنها به سیر و حرکت می‌پردازند. صورتهای فلکی که هر یک مجموعه‌ای از ستارگانند که شکل ویژه‌ای به خود گرفته‌اند. «زَیَّنَّاهَا»: آن را زینت داده‌ایم و آراسته و پیراسته کرده‌ایم. مرجع ضمیر (هَا) واژه (السَّمَآءِ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به راستی در آسمان برجهایی آفریدیم و آن را در چشم تماشاگران آراستیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما در آسمان برجهایی قرار دادیم؛ و آن را برای بینندگان آراستیم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا نهادیم در آسمان برجهائی و آراستیم آنها را برای بینندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه در آسمان برجهايى پديد كرديم و آن را از بهر بينندگان بياراستيم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به‌راستی بی‌گمان ما در آسمان کاخ‌هایی (وحیانی) قرار دادیم و آنها را برای تماشاگران (زمین و آسمان) آراستیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We have placed the signs of the Zodiac in the sky, and decked it out for those who can see;

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed We created towers in the skies, and beautified it for the beholders.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We have set in heaven constellations and decked them out fair to the beholders,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And assuredly We have set constellations in the heaven and made it fairseeming unto the beholders

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And indeed, We have put the big stars in the heaven and We beautified it for the beholders.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We placed constellations in the sky, and made them beautiful to the beholders.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We have indeed set constellations in the heavens and have beautified them for the beholders,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And indeed, We have put the big stars in the heaven and We beautified it for the beholders.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And verily in the heaven we have set mansions of the stars, and We have beautified it for beholders.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Certainly We have appointed houses in the sky and adorned them for the onlookers,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We have set constellations in the heavens and made them pleasing to the beholders,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We have placed within the heaven great stars and have beautified it for the observers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We have made constellations in the sky and decorated them for the onlookers.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And certainly We have made strongholds in the heaven and We have made it fair seeming to the beholders.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Walaqad jaAAalna fee alssamai buroojan wazayyannaha lilnnathireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have placed constellations in heaven and have beautified it for beholders,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: It is We Who have set out the zodiacal signs in the heavens, and made them fair-seeming to (all) beholders;

verses.text: وَ حَفِظْنَاهَا مِنْ‌ کُلِ‌ شَيْطَانٍ‌ رَجِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آن را از هر شیطان رانده شده ای حفظ کردیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و از هر شيطان رجيمى حفظشان كرديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آن را از [ورود] هر شيطان مطرودى نگاه داشتيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و آن را از هر شيطان رانده‌شده‌اى حفظ كرديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آن را از (دستبرد) هر شیطان مردودی محفوظ داشتیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و آسمان را از (دستبرد و دسترسی) هر اهریمن ملعون و مطرودی محفوظ و مصون داشته‌ایم. [[«رَجِیمٍ»: نفرین شده. رانده از رحمت الهی. فعیل به معنی مفعول است. یعنی: مطرود. ملعون.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و از [دستبرد] هر شیطان مطرودی محفوظ داشتیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آن را از هر شیطان رانده شده‌ای حفظ کردیم؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و حفظ کردیم آنها را از هر شیطانی رانده‌شده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آن را از [ورود] هر شيطان رانده‌شده‌اى نگاه داشتيم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (هم) آن‌ها را از هر شیطان رانده‌شده‌ای نگه داشتیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And We have preserved it from every accursed devil,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We have kept it guarded from every outcast devil.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and guarded them from every accursed Satan

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We have guarded it from every Satan damned.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We have guarded it (near heaven) from every outcast Shaitan (devil).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We guarded them from every outcast devil.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and have protected them against every accursed satan

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We have guarded it (near heaven) from every outcast Shaytan (devil).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We have guarded it from every outcast devil,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and We have guarded them from every outcast Satan,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and guarded them from every stoned satan.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We have protected it from every devil expelled [from the mercy of Allah]

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We have protected them from every condemned devil,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We guard it against every accursed Shaitan,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wahafithnaha min kulli shaytanin rajeemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and We have guarded it from every accursed devil:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And (moreover) We have guarded them from every cursed devil:

verses.text: إِلاَّ مَنِ‌ اسْتَرَقَ‌ السَّمْعَ‌ فَأَتْبَعَهُ‌ شِهَابٌ‌ مُبِينٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مگر آنکه دزدانه [خبرهای عالم بالا را] بشنود، که شهابی روشن او را دنبال می کند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر آنكه دزدانه گوش مى‌داد و شهابى روشن تعقيبش كرد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر آن كس كه دزديده گوش فرا دهد كه شهابى روشن او را دنبال مى‌كند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مگر آن كس كه دزديده گوش فرا دهد كه شهابى روشن او را دنبال مى‌كند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: لیکن هر شیطانی برای سرقت سمع (یعنی برای دزدیدن و دریافتن سخن فرشتگان عالم بالا) به آسمان نزدیک شود تیر شهاب و شعله آسمانی او را تعقیب کند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و امّا هر که از آنها دزدکی گوش فرا دارد، آذرخش روشنی به سراغ او می‌رود. [[«إِلاّ»: لکن. امّا. «إِسْتَرَقَ السَّمْعَ»: دزدکی گوش فرا داد. چگونگی حفظ آسمان و نحوه استراق سمع شیاطین برای ما چندان روشن نیست.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر کسی که دزدانه [رازی‌] بشنود، که شهابی روشن در پی او خواهد افتاد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مگر آن کس که استراق سمع کند (و دزدانه گوش فرا دهد) که «شهاب مبین» او را تعقیب می‌کند (و می‌راند)

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: مگر آنکه بدزدد شنیدن را (دزدکی شنود) که در پیش افتد شهابی آشکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر آن كه دزدانه سخنى بشنود، كه شهابى روشن و آشكار دنبالش كند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: مگر کسی که دزدانه گوش فرا دهد، پس نیزه‌ی آتشینِ آشکارگری او را دنبال کند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Except the ones who listen on the sly, yet they are chased away by a shooting flame.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Except one who comes to eavesdrop – therefore a bright flame goes after him.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: excepting such as listens by stealth -- and he is pursued by a manifest flame.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Save him who stealeth the hearing, and him there followeth a flame gleaming.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Except him (devil) that gains hearing by stealing, he is pursued by a clear flaming fire.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Except one who steals a hearing, and is followed by a visible projectile.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: save him who may eavesdrop, and then a bright flame pursues him.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Except him (devil) who steals the hearing, then he is pursued by a clear flaming fire.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Save him who stealeth the hearing, and them doth a clear flame pursue.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: except someone who may eavesdrop, whereat there pursues him a manifest flame.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Except for he who steals the listening and is then pursued by a visible flame.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Except one who steals a hearing and is pursued by a clear burning flame.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: except for those who stealthily try to listen to the heavens, but who are chased away by a bright flame.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But he who steals a hearing, so there follows him a visible flame.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa mani istaraqa alssamAAa faatbaAAahu shihabun mubeenun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but if anyone eavesdrops, he is pursued by a bright flaming fire.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But any that gains a hearing by stealth, is pursued by a flaming fire, bright (to see).

verses.text: وَ الْأَرْضَ‌ مَدَدْنَاهَا وَ أَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ‌ وَ أَنْبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِنْ‌ کُلِ‌ شَيْ‌ءٍ مَوْزُونٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و زمین را گستراندیم و در آن کوه های استوار افکندیم، واز هر گیاه موزون وسنجیده ای در آن رویاندیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و زمين را گسترديم و در آن كوه‌هاى عظيم افكنديم. و از هر چيز به شيوه‌اى سنجيده در آن رويانيديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و زمين را گسترديم و در آن كوه‌هاى استوار افكنديم و در آن از هر چيز متناسب [نياز انسان‌] رويانديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و زمين را گسترانيديم و در آن كوههاى استوار افكنديم و از هر چيز سنجيده‌اى در آن رويانيديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و زمین را هم ما بگستردیم و در آن کوههای عظیم بر نهادیم و در آن از هر گیاه و هر نبات مناسب و موافق حکمت و عنایت برویانیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما زمین را گسترانیده‌ایم و در زمین کوههای استوار و پابرجائی را پدید آورده‌ایم، و همه چیز را به گونه‌ی سنجیده و هماهنگ و در اندازه‌های متناسب و مشخّص در آن ایجاد کرده‌ایم. [[«مَدَدْنَاهَا»: آن را گسترانیده‌ایم و در ظاهر مسطّحش کرده‌ایم. «أَنبَتْنَا»: رویانیده‌ایم. آفریده‌ایم (نوح / 17). «مَوْزُونٍ»: هماهنگ. متناسب. «مِن کُلِّ شَیْءٍ مَّوْزُونٍ»: انواع و اقسام درختان و گیاهان، با نظم و نظام شگرف و حساب و کتاب دقیق. هر چیزی را با اندازه و مقدار مشخّص و معیّن و متناسب و مرتبط به یکدیگر.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و زمین را گسترانیدیم و در آن کوههای استوار در انداختیم و در آن از هر چیز سنجیده‌ای رویانیدیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و زمین را گستردیم؛ و در آن کوه‌های ثابتی افکندیم؛ و از هر گیاه موزون، در آن رویاندیم؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و زمین را گسترانیدیم و افکندیم در آن لنگرهائی و رویانیدیم در آن از هر چیزی زیبا

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و زمين را گسترديم و در آن كوه‌هاى استوار افكنديم و در آن از هر چيز سنجيده و به اندازه رويانيديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و زمین را گستراندیم، و در آن کوه‌هایی پابرجا (و بلند بالا) فرو افکندیم و از هر چیز سنجیده شده‌ای، به اندازه در آن رویاندیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We stretched the earth and placed upon it firm stabilisers, and made all things grow upon it balanced evenly.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We spread out the earth, and placed mountains as anchors in it, and in it grew all things by a proper measure.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And the earth -- We stretched it forth, and cast on it firm mountains, and We caused to grow therein of every thing justly weighed,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And the earth! We have stretched it out and have cast thereon mountains firm, and We have caused to spring up thereon everything weighed.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And the earth We spread out, and placed therein firm mountains, and caused to grow therein all kinds of things in due proportion.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We spread the earth, and placed stabilizers in it, and in it We grew all things in proper measure.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: As for the earth, We have stretched it out and have cast on it firm mountains, and have caused to grow in it everything well-measured.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We have spread out the earth, and have placed firm mountains in it, and caused all kinds of things to grow in it, in due proportion.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the earth have We spread out, and placed therein firm hills, and caused each seemly thing to grow therein.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And We spread out the earth, and cast in it firm mountains, and We grew in it every kind of balanced thing,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We have spread out the earth and set upon it firm mountains. Everything We have caused to grow therein is justly weighed;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the earth - We have spread it and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-balanced thing.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We have spread out the earth, fixed mountains thereupon and caused everything to grow to its proper weight

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the earth-- We have spread it forth and made in it firm mountains and caused to grow in it of every suitable thing.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waalarda madadnaha waalqayna feeha rawasiya waanbatna feeha min kulli shayin mawzoonin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have spread out the earth, and set upon it firm mountains and caused everything to grow in due proportion.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And the earth We have spread out (like a carpet); set thereon mountains firm and immovable; and produced therein all kinds of things in due balance.

verses.text: وَ جَعَلْنَا لَکُمْ‌ فِيهَا مَعَايِشَ‌ وَ مَنْ‌ لَسْتُمْ‌ لَهُ‌ بِرَازِقِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و در آن برای شما و کسانی که روزی دهنده آنان نیستید، انواع وسایل و ابزار معیشت قرار دادیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و معيشت شما و كسانى را كه شما روزى‌دهشان نيستيد، در آنجا قرار داديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
