translations.text: گفت: پروردگارا! به سبب این که (به خاطر این انسان) مرا گمراه ساختی، (معاصی و اعمال زشت را) در زمین برایشان می‌آرایم و جملگی آنان را گمراه می‌نمایم. [[«بِما»: به سبب این که. حرف (ب) سببیّه، و واژه (ما) مصدریّه است. «لَهُمْ»: برای ایشان. مراد آدمیزادگان است (نگا: اعراف / 16).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت پروردگارا از آنجا که مرا فریفتی، در روی زمین در نظر آنان [بدی را نیک‌] خواهم آراست، و همگی آنان را به گمراهی خواهم کشاند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «پروردگارا! چون مرا گمراه ساختی، من (نعمتهای مادّی را) در زمین در نظر آنها زینت می‌دهم، و همگی را گمراه خواهم ساخت،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت پروردگارا بدانکه گمراهم کردی همانا آرایش دهم برای ایشان در زمین و هر آینه گمراهشان کنم همگی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: خداوندا، به سبب آنكه مرا به راه هلاكت افكندى هر آينه در زمين [باطل را] در نظرشان مى‌آرايم- آنان را خواهم فريفت- و همگيشان را به راه هلاكت مى‌برم،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «پروردگارم! به این که مرا گمراه ساختی، من (هم) بی‌چون و بی‌گمان در زمین (همه چیز را) برایشان می‌آرایم، و همانا همواره گمراه(شان) خواهم ساخت.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "O my Lord," he said, "since You have led me into error I'll beguile them with the pleasures of the world and lead them astray,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “My Lord! I swear by the fact that You sent me astray, I shall distract them in the earth, and I shall lead all of them astray.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said he, 'My Lord, for Thy perverting me I shall deck all fair to them in the earth, and I shall pervert them, all together,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: my Lord! because Thou hast led me to err I will surely make things fairseeming unto them on the earth and will surely seduce them all:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [Iblis (Satan)] said: "O my Lord! Because you misled me, I shall indeed adorn the path of error for them (mankind) on the earth, and I shall mislead them all.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “My Lord, since You have lured me away, I will glamorize for them on earth, and I will lure them all away.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Iblis said: "My Lord! In the manner You led me to error, I will make things on earth seem attractive to them and lead all of them to error,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: [Iblis] said: "O my Lord! Because You misled me, I shall indeed adorn the path of error for them (mankind) on the earth, and I shall mislead them all."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: My Lord! Because Thou hast sent me astray, I verily shall adorn the path of error for them in the earth, and shall mislead them every one,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘My Lord! As You have consigned me to perversity, I will surely glamorize [evil] for them on the earth, and I will surely pervert them, all

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (satan) said: 'My Lord, for Your perverting me, I shall make (matters) in the earth seem most fair to them and I shall pervert all,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Iblees] said, "My Lord, because You have put me in error, I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them on earth, and I will mislead them all

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Iblis said, "Lord, because you have caused me to go astray, I shall make earthly things attractive to (people) and mislead all of them

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: My Lord! because Thou hast made life evil to me, I will certainly make (evil) fair-seeming to them on earth, and I will certainly cause them all to deviate

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala rabbi bima aghwaytanee laozayyinanna lahum fee alardi walaoghwiyannahum ajmaAAeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He said, "My Lord, since You have let me go astray. I shall make the path of error seem alluring to them on the earth and shall mislead them all,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! because Thou hast put me in the wrong, I will make (wrong) fair-seeming to them on the earth, and I will put them all in the wrong,-

verses.text: إِلاَّ عِبَادَکَ‌ مِنْهُمُ‌ الْمُخْلَصِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مگر [آن] بندگانت را که خالص شدگانِ [از هر نوع آلودگی ظاهری و باطنی] اند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر آنها كه بندگان با اخلاص تو باشند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر بندگان خالص شده‌ى تو را از ميان آنها

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مگر بندگان خالص تو از ميان آنان را.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: به جز بندگان پاک و برگزیده تو را.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مگر بندگان گزیده و پاکیزه‌ی تو از ایشان. (که چون دلهایشان به یاد تو آباد است، تلاش من در حق آنان بر باد است). [[«الْمُخْلَصِینَ»: گزیدگان. پاکیزگان (نگا: یوسف / 24، ص 46 و47).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر آن بندگان اخلاص یافته‌ات را

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مگر بندگان مخلصت را.»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جز بندگان تو از ایشان آن ناآلودگان (پاک‌شدگان)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر آن بندگانت، از ميان آنان، كه پاك و ويژه و برگزيده تو باشند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «مگر خالص‌شدگان (ربانی) از بندگانت را.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Except the chosen ones among Your creatures."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Except those among them who are Your chosen bondmen.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: excepting those Thy servants among them that are devoted.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: But not such of them as are Thy bondmen single-hearted.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Except Your chosen, (guided) slaves among them."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “Except for Your sincere servants among them.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: except those of Your servants whom You have singled out for Yourself."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Except Your chosen (guided) servants among them."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Save such of them as are Thy perfectly devoted slaves.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: except Your dedicated servants among them.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: except the devoted amongst Your worshippers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: except Your sincere servants".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Except Thy servants from among them, the devoted ones.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa AAibadaka minhumu almukhlaseena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: except for Your chosen servants."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Except Thy servants among them, sincere and purified (by Thy Grace)."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ هٰذَا صِرَاطٌ عَلَيَ‌ مُسْتَقِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: خدا فرمود: این [پیراسته شدن از هر ناخالصی] راهی است مستقیم [که تحقّقش در وجود بندگان مخلصم] برعهده من [است.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: راه اخلاص راه راستى است كه به من مى‌رسد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [خداى‌] گفت: اين سنت و راه راستى است بر عهده‌ى من

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: فرمود: «اين راهى است راست [كه‌] به سوى من [منتهى مى‌شود].

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: خدا فرمود: همین (اخلاص و پاکی سریرت) راه مستقیم به (درگاه رضای) من است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: فرمود: این (خلوص بندگان راستین) طریقه‌ی درستی است که دقیقاً راه به سوی من دارد، (و حفظ ایشان از گمراهی، شیوه‌ی صحیحی است که من آن را بر عهده گرفته‌ام). [[«هذا»: این راهی که پویندگان مخلص راه توحید در پیش گرفته‌اند. این محافظت و مراقبت از جویندگان راستین راه حق در برابر وسوسه‌های اهریمن. «عَلَیَّ»: بر من است. راه به سوی من دارد. در صورت دوم، (عَلی) به معنی (إلَی) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: فرمود این راهی است که تا به پیشگاه من مستقیم است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: فرمود: «این راه مستقیمی است که بر عهده من است (و سنّت همیشگیم)...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت این است راهی بر من راست‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [خداى‌] گفت: اين راهى است راست كه [نگاهداشت آن‌] بر من است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: فرمود: «این راهی است راست برعهده‌ی من.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (To which God) said: "This way is right by Me.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Said Allah, “This path* leads straight towards Me.” (* The path of the chosen bondmen.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said He, 'This is for Me a straight path:

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Allah said: this is the path leeding unto Me straight.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Allah) said: "This is the Way which will lead straight to Me."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “This is a right way with Me.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Allah said: "Here is the path that leads straight to Me.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (Allah) said: "This is the way which will lead straight to Me."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: This is a right course incumbent upon Me:

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘This is the path [leading] straight to Me.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He (Allah) said: 'This is for Me the Right Path

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Allah] said, "This is a path [of return] to Me [that is] straight.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: God said, "The path which leads to Me is a straight

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: This is a right way with Me:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala hatha siratun AAalayya mustaqeemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: God said, "This is the path which leads straight to Me.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Allah) said: "This (way of My sincere servants) is indeed a way that leads straight to Me.

verses.text: إِنَ‌ عِبَادِي‌ لَيْسَ‌ لَکَ‌ عَلَيْهِمْ‌ سُلْطَانٌ‌ إِلاَّ مَنِ‌ اتَّبَعَکَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْغَاوِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: قطعاً تو را بر بندگانم تسلّطی نیست، مگر بر گمراهانی که از تو پیروی می کنند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: تو را بر بندگان من تسلطى نيست، مگر بر آن گمراهانى كه تو را پيروى كنند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه تو را بر بندگان من تسلطى نيست، جز كسانى از گمراهان كه تو را پيروى كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: در حقيقت، تو را بر بندگان من تسلّطى نيست، مگر كسانى از گمراهان كه تو را پيروى كنند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هرگز تو را بر بندگان (برگزیده) من تسلط و غلبه نخواهد بود لیکن اقتدار و سلطه تو بر مردم گمراهی است که پیرو تو شوند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بی‌گمان تو هیچ گونه تسلّط و قدرتی بر بندگان من نداری، مگر آن گمراهانی که (به وسوسه‌ی تو گوش فرا بدهند و) به دنبال تو راه بیفتند. [[«سُلْطَانٌ»: تسلّط و قدرت. مراد واداشتن به گناهان با اجبار و اکراه است. چرا که تنها کاری که از دست اهریمن ساخته است وسوسه کردن است (نگا: اعراف / 200 و 201، ابراهیم / 22، نحل / 99 و 100، صافّات / 30). «الْغَاوِینَ»: گمراهان و سرگشتگان. ناباوران و بی‌دینان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بدان که بر بندگان [خالص‌] من دست نخواهی یافت، مگر کسانی از گمراهان که از تو پیروی کنند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که بر بندگانم تسلّط نخواهی یافت؛ مگر گمراهانی که از تو پیروی می‌کنند؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که بندگانم را نباشدت بر ایشان فرمانروائیی مگر آنکه پیرویت کند از گمراهان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا تو را بر بندگان [ويژه‌] من دستيابى و چيرگى نيست، مگر روندگان راه هلاكت كه تو را پيروى كنند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «بی‌گمان، تو را بر بندگان من هیچ سلطه‌ای نیست، مگر کسانی از گمراهان که تو را پیروی کردند،»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: No power shall you have over (all) My creatures except those who fall into error and follow you,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Indeed you do not have any power over My bondmen, except those wanderers who follow you.” (The devil is unsuccessful in tempting Allah’s chosen bondmen to commit sin.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: over My servants thou shalt have no authority, except those that follow thee,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily as for My bondmen, no authority shalt thou have over them, except the erring one who follow thee.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Certainly, you shall have no authority over My slaves, except those who follow you of the Ghawin (Mushrikun and those who go astray, criminals, polytheists, and evil-doers, etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “Over My servants you have no authority, except for the sinners who follow you.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Over My true servants you will be able to exercise no power, your power will be confined to the erring ones, those who choose to follow you.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Certainly, you shall have no authority over My servants, except those of the astray who follow you."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! as for My slaves, thou hast no power over any of them save such of the froward as follow thee,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed, as for My servants you do not have any authority over them, except the perverse who follow you,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: over My worshipers you have no authority, except the perverse that follow you.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, My servants - no authority will you have over them, except those who follow you of the deviators.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and you have no authority over My servants except the erring ones who follow you.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely. as regards My servants, you have no authority, over them except those who follow you of the deviators.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna AAibadee laysa laka AAalayhim sultanun illa mani ittabaAAaka mina alghaweena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Surely, you shall have no power over My true servants, except those misguided ones who choose to follow you.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "For over My servants no authority shalt thou have, except such as put themselves in the wrong and follow thee."

verses.text: وَ إِنَ‌ جَهَنَّمَ‌ لَمَوْعِدُهُمْ‌ أَجْمَعِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و مسلماً دوزخ، وعده گاه همگی آنان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و جهنم ميعادگاه همه است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و قطعا جهنم وعده‌گاه همه آنهاست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و قطعاً وعده‌گاه همه آنان دوزخ است،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و البته وعده‌گاه جمیع آن مردم گمراه نیز آتش دوزخ خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و حتماً دوزخ میعادگاه جملگی آنان است. [[«لَمَوْعِدُهُمْ»: میعادگاه ایشان. وعده آنان. مَوْعِد اسم مکان یا مصدر میمی است و مرجع ضمیر (هُمْ)، (الْغَاوِینَ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بی‌گمان جهنم میعادگاه همگی آنان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و دوزخ، میعادگاه همه آنهاست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا دوزخ است وعده‌گاه آنان همگی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و همانا دوزخ وعده‌گاه همه آنهاست

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و همواره وعده‌گاه همگی آنان بی‌چون دوزخ است.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For whom the ordained place is surely Hell,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed hell is the promise for all of them.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: being perverse; Gehenna shall be their promised land all together.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily Hell is the place promised unto them all.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And surely, Hell is the promised place for them all.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And Hell is the meeting-place for them all.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Surely Hell is the promised place for all of them."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And surely, Hell is the place promised for them all.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! for all such, hell will be the promised place.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and indeed hell is the tryst of them all.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Gehenna (Hell) will be the promise for all of them.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, Hell is the promised place for them all.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Hell is the promised place for them all.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And surely Hell is the promised place of them all:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna jahannama lamawAAiduhum ajmaAAeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Surely, Hell is the place to which they are destined,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And verily, Hell is the promised abode for them all!

verses.text: لَهَا سَبْعَةُ أَبْوَابٍ‌ لِکُلِ‌ بَابٍ‌ مِنْهُمْ‌ جُزْءٌ مَقْسُومٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: برای آن هفت در است، برای هر دری گروهی از پیروان شیطان تقسیم شده اند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هفت در دارد و براى هر در گروهى از آنان معين شده‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آن را هفت در است و براى هر درى، گروه معينى از آن [گمراه‌] ها تقسيم شده‌اند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [دوزخى‌] كه براى آن هفت در است، و از هر درى بخشى معين از آنان [وارد مى‌شوند].

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که آن دوزخ را هفت در است که هر دری برای ورود دسته‌ای از گمراهان معین گردیده است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: دوزخ دارای هفت در است و هر دری بخش خاصّ و ویژه‌ای از آنان دارد (که از آن به دوزخ درمی‌آیند و متناسب با اعمال زشت و پلشت ایشان است). [[«جُزْءٌ مُّقْسُومٌ»: بهره جداگانه. مراد طائفه معیّن و گروه مشخّصی است که به تناسب عذاب از آن در به دوزخ می‌آیند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که هفت طبقه دارد و بخشی جدا کرده از آنان خاص هر طبقه است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هفت در دارد؛ و برای هر دری، گروه معیّنی از آنها تقسیم شده‌اند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: برای آن است هفت در هر دری را است از ایشان بخشی جداگانه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آن را هفت در است كه هر درى را بخشى جداگانه از آنان

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «برای آن هفت در است و از هر دری بخشی معین از آنِ آنان است.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Which has several gates, and each gate is marked for every section of them."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: It has seven gates; for each gate is a portion assigned from them.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Seven gates it has, and unto each gate a set portion of them belongs.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Unto it are seven portals; unto each portal is a Portion of them assigned.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "It (Hell) has seven gates, for each of those gates is a (special) class (of sinners) assigned.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “It has seven doors; for each door is an assigned class.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: There are seven gates in it, and to each gate a portion of them has been allotted.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: It has seven gates, for each of those gates is a class assigned.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: It hath seven gates, and each gate hath an appointed portion.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It has seven gates, and to each gate belongs a separate portion of them.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It has seven gates, and through each gate a portion of them belong.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: It has seven gates; for every gate is of them a portion designated."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It has seven gates and each gate is assigned for a certain group of people.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: It has seven gates; for every gate there shall be a separate party of them.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Laha sabAAatu abwabin likulli babin minhum juzon maqsoomun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: it has seven gates: and each gate has a portion of them allotted to it.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: To it are seven gates: for each of those gates is a (special) class (of sinners) assigned.

verses.text: إِنَ‌ الْمُتَّقِينَ‌ فِي‌ جَنَّاتٍ‌ وَ عُيُونٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به یقین، پرهیزکاران در بهشت ها و چشمه سارها هستند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پرهيزگاران در بهشتها، كنار چشمه‌سارانند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بى‌گمان، پرهيزكاران در باغ‌ها و چشمه‌سارانند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بى‌گمان، پرهيزگاران در باغها و چشمه‌سارانند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: البته اهل تقوا در باغها و نهرهای جاری خواهند بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (این پادافره پیروان شیطان بود، و امّا پاداش پویندگان راه یزدان، این است که:) بی‌گمان پرهیزگاران در میان باغها و چشمه‌ساران (بهشت) بسر می‌برند. [[«عُیُون»: جمع عَیْن، چشمه‌ها.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [اما] پرهیزگاران در باغها[ی بهشتی‌] و چشمه‌سارانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: به یقین، پرهیزگاران در باغها (ی سرسبز بهشت) و در کنار چشمه‌ها هستند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا پرهیزکارانند در باغها و چشمه‌سارهائی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا پرهيزگاران در بوستانها و چشمه‌سارهايند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: همواره، پرهیزگاران در باغ‌هایی سر در هم و چشمه‌سارانی‌می‌باشند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Verily those who keep away from evil and follow the straight path shall be in the midst of gardens and springs of water.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed the pious are amidst Gardens and springs.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But the godfearing shall be amidst gardens and fountains:

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily the God-fearing shall be amidst gardens and springs.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Truly! The Muttaqun (pious and righteous persons - see V. 2:2) will be amidst Gardens and water-springs (Paradise).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But the righteous will be in gardens with springs.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: As for the God-fearing, they shall be amid gardens and springs.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Truly, those who have Taqwa, will dwell in Gardens and water springs.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! those who ward off (evil) are among gardens and watersprings.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed the Godwary will be amid gardens and springs.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But the cautious shall live amongst gardens and fountains:

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, the righteous will be within gardens and springs.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The pious will live in gardens with streams

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely those who guard (against evil) shall be in the midst of gardens and fountains:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna almuttaqeena fee jannatin waAAuyoonin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Truly, the God-fearing shall dwell amid gardens and fountains --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The righteous (will be) amid gardens and fountains (of clear-flowing water).

verses.text: ادْخُلُوهَا بِسَلاَمٍ‌ آمِنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [به آنان گویند:] با سلامت و امنیت وارد آنجا شوید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به سلامت و ايمنى داخل شويد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [به آنها گويند] به سلامت و ايمنى داخل آن شويد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [به آنان گويند:] «با سلامت و ايمنى در آنجا داخل شويد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (به آنها خطاب شود که) شما با درود و سلام و با کمال ایمنی و احترام به بهشت ابد وارد شوید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (پروردگارشان بدانان می‌گوید:) با اطمینان خاطر و بدون هیچ گونه خوف و هراسی به این باغها و چشمه‌سارها درآئید. [[«بِسَلامٍ»: به سلامت. با درود خدا و دربانان بهشت و فرشتگان به شما (نگا: رعد / 24، یس / 58، زمر / 73). «آمِنِینَ»: در امن و در امان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [به آنان گویند] به سلامت و در امن و امان به آنجا درآیید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (فرشتگان به آنها می‌گویند:) داخل این باغها شوید با سلامت و امنیّت!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: درآئیدش به سلامت بر آسودگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [گويندشان:] به سلامت و ايمنى در آنها در آييد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (به آنان گویند:) «با سلامت و ایمنی داخل آنها شوید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "Enter in peace and tranquility," (they will be told).

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Enter them with peace, in safety.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'Enter you them, in peace and security!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Enter therein in peace, secure.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "(It will be said to them): 'Enter therein (Paradise), in peace and security.'

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “Enter it in peace and security.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They will be told: "Enter it in peace and security."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (It will be said to them): "Enter it in peace and security."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (And it is said unto them): Enter them in peace, secure.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘‘Enter it in peace and safety!’’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'In peace and security, enter them'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Having been told], "Enter it in peace, safe [and secure]."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and they will be told to enter there in peace and safety.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Enter them in peace, secure.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Odkhulooha bisalamin amineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "Enter therein in peace and security!" --

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Their greeting will be): "Enter ye here in peace and security."

verses.text: وَ نَزَعْنَا مَا فِي‌ صُدُورِهِمْ‌ مِنْ‌ غِلٍ‌ إِخْوَاناً عَلَى‌ سُرُرٍ مُتَقَابِلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آنچه از دشمنی و کینه در سینه هایشان بوده برکنده ایم که برادروار بر تخت هایی روبروی یکدیگرند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر كينه‌اى را از دلشان بركنده‌ايم، همه برادرند، بر تختها روبه‌روى همند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و هر كينه‌اى را از سينه آنها برداشتيم، كه برادرانه بر تخت‌ها رو به روى هم قرار گيرند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و آنچه كينه [و شائبه‌هاى نفسانى‌] در سينه‌هاى آنان است بركنيم؛ برادرانه بر تختهايى روبروى يكديگر نشسته‌اند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما آیینه دلهای پاک آنها را از کدورت کینه و حسد و هر خلق ناپسند به کلی پاک و پاکیزه ساختیم و همه برادروار روبروی یکدیگر بر تختهای عزت بنشینند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و کینه‌توزی و دشمنانگی را از سینه‌هایشان بیرون می‌کشیم، و برادرانه بر تختها رویاروی هم می‌نشینند. [[«نَزَعْنَا»: بیرون کشیدیم. به در آوردیم. «غِلٍّ»: کینه‌توزی و دشمنانگی (نگا: اعراف / 43، حشر / 10). «إِخْوَاناً»: برادران در مودّت و مخالطت، یعنی: دوستان. حال (الْمُتَّقینَ) یا ضمیر (و) در (أُدْخُلُوا) یا ضمیر مستتر در (آمِنِینَ) یا ضمیر (هُمْ) در (صُدُورِهِمْ) می‌باشد. «سُرُرٍ»: جمع سَریر، تخت‌ها. «مُتَقَابِلینَ»: روبه‌روی هم. برابر یکدیگر. صفت (إِخْوَاناً) یا حال ضمیر مستتر در آن است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و از سینه‌های آنان هر گونه کینه‌ای را می‌زداییم، و دوستانه بر تختها رویاروی بنشینند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هر گونه غلِّ [= حسد و کینه و دشمنی‌] را از سینه آنها برمی‌کنیم (و روحشان را پاک می‌سازیم)؛ در حالی که همه برابرند، و بر تختها روبه‌روی یکدیگر قرار دارند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و برافکندیم آنچه در سینه‌های ایشان است از کینه برادرانند بر تختهائی روی بروی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر بدخواهى و كينه‌اى كه در سينه‌هاشان بود بركنديم برادرانى بر تخت هايى روياروى هم‌اند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و آنچه کینه (و شائبه‌های نفسانی) در سینه‌هاشان است برکندیم، (و) برادرانه بر تخت‌هایی رویاروی یکدیگرند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We shall cast out any grudge they may have in their hearts. (There) they will sit on couches face to face like brothers together.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We have removed any resentments which were in their breasts – they are brothers, sitting face to face on thrones.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We shall strip away all rancour that is in their breasts; as brothers they shall be upon couches set face to face;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We shall have removed whatsoever of grudge may be in their breasts: brethren they. sitting upon couches facing each other.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And We shall remove from their breasts any sense of injury (that they may have), (So they will be like) brothers facing each other on thrones.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We will remove all ill-feelings from their hearts—brothers and sisters, on couches facing one another.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And We shall purge their breasts of all traces of rancour; and they shall be seated on couches facing one another as brothers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We shall remove any deep feeling of bitterness from their breasts. (So they will be like) brothers facing each other on thrones.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We remove whatever rancour may be in their breasts. As brethren, face to face, (they rest) on couches raised.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We will remove whatever rancour there is in their breasts; [intimate like] brothers, [they will be reclining] on couches, facing one another.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We shall remove all rancor from their hearts, and as brethren they shall recline on couches face to face.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment, [so they will be] brothers, on thrones facing each other.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We shall remove all hatred from their breasts and make them as brothers reclining on thrones facing one another.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We will root out whatever of rancor is in their breasts-- (they shall be) as brethren, on raised couches, face to face.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WanazaAAna ma fee sudoorihim min ghillin ikhwanan AAala sururin mutaqabileena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We shall cleanse their hearts of all traces of ill-will; they will be like brethren seated on couches facing one another.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We shall remove from their hearts any lurking sense of injury: (they will be) brothers (joyfully) facing each other on thrones (of dignity).

verses.text: لاَ يَمَسُّهُمْ‌ فِيهَا نَصَبٌ‌ وَ مَا هُمْ‌ مِنْهَا بِمُخْرَجِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در آنجا خستگی و رنجی به آنان نمی رسد و هیچ گاه از آنجا اخراج نمی شوند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هيچ رنجى به آنها نمى‌رسد و از آنجا بيرونشان نرانند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: در آن جا رنجى به آنان نرسد و نه از آن بيرون رانده مى‌شوند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: نه رنجى در آنجا به آنان مى‌رسد و نه از آنجا بيرون رانده مى‌شوند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در حالتی که هیچ رنج و زحمت در آنجا به آنها نرسد و هرگز از آن بهشت ابد بیرونشان نکنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در آنجا خستگی و رنجی بدیشان نمی‌رسد، و از آنجا بیرون نمی‌گردند. [[«نَصَبٌ»: خستگی. رنج (نگا: توبه / 120). «مُخْرَجِینَ»: اخراج‌شدگان. بیرون رانده‌شدگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: نه به آنان در آنجا خستگی و ماندگی رسد، و نه از آنجا بیرونشان کنند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هیچ خستگی و تعبی در آنجا به آنها نمی‌رسد، و هیچ گاه از آن اخراج نمی‌گردند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نزدیک بدیشان نشود رنجی و نباشند از آن برون‌راندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: در آنجا رنجى بديشان نرسد و از آنجا بيرونشان نكنند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: نه رنجی در آنها به آنان در رسد و نه از آنجا بیرون شوندگانند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: No weariness will come upon them, nor will they be sent away from there.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Neither any hardship is to reach them in it, nor are they to be expelled from it.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: no fatigue there shall smite them, neither shall they ever be driven forth from there.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: There shall touch them no toil therein, nor therefrom they shall ever be driven out.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "No sense of fatigue shall touch them, nor shall they (ever) be asked to leave it."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: No fatigue will ever touch them therein, nor will they be asked to leave it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They shall face no fatigue in it, nor shall they ever be driven out of it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: No sense of fatigue shall touch them, nor shall they be asked to leave it.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Toil cometh not unto them there, nor will they be expelled from thence.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Therein neither weariness shall touch them, nor will they [ever] be expelled from it.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: There, no fatigue shall smite them, nor shall they ever be driven from it'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: No fatigue will touch them therein, nor from it will they [ever] be removed.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: No fatigue will touch them nor will they be expelled therefrom."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Toil shall not afflict them in it, nor shall they be ever ejected from it.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: La yamassuhum feeha nasabun wama hum minha bimukhrajeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They will not be affected by any weariness there, and they will never be made to leave."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: There no sense of fatigue shall touch them, nor shall they (ever) be asked to leave.

verses.text: نَبِّئْ‌ عِبَادِي‌ أَنِّي‌ أَنَا الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به بندگانم خبر ده که یقیناً من [نسبت به مؤمنان] بسیار آمرزنده و مهربانم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به بندگانم خبر ده كه من آمرزنده و مهربانم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به بندگان من خبر ده كه همانا من آمرزنده‌ى مهربانم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: به بندگان من خبر ده كه منم آمرزنده مهربان.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (ای رسول ما) بندگان مرا آگاه ساز که من بسیار آمرزنده و مهربانم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ای پیغمبر!) بندگان مرا آگاه کن که من دارای گذشت زیاد و مهر فراوان هستم (در حق کسانی که توبه بکنند و ایمان بیاورند و کار نیک انجام بدهند). [[«نَبِّئْ»: باخبر کن.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: به بندگان من خبر ده که من آمرزگار مهربانم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بندگانم را آگاه کن که من بخشنده مهربانم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آگهی ده بندگانم را که منم آمرزنده مهربان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بندگانم را خبر ده كه من آمرزگار و مهربانم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بندگانم را خبری مهم ده که همانا من خود بس پوشنده‌ای رحمتگر بر ویژگانم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Announce to My creatures that I am indeed forgiving and kind,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Inform My bondmen that undoubtedly, I surely am the Oft-Forgiving, the Most Merciful.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Tell My servants I am the All-forgiving, the All-compassionate,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Declare thou unto My bondmen: verily I! I am the Forgiver, the Merciful.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Declare (O Muhammad SAW) unto My slaves, that truly, I am the Oft-Forgiving, the Most-Merciful.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Inform My servants that I am the Forgiver, the Merciful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (O Prophet), declare to My servants that I am indeed Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Declare to My servants that I am truly the Forgiving, the Most Merciful.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Announce, (O Muhammad) unto My slaves that verily I am the Forgiving, the Merciful,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Inform my servants that I am indeed the All-forgiving, the All-merciful,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Tell My worshipers that I am the Forgiving, the Most Merciful,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [O Muhammad], inform My servants that it is I who am the Forgiving, the Merciful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), tell My servants that I am All-forgiving and All-merciful

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Inform My servants that I am the Forgiving, the Merciful,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Nabbi AAibadee annee ana alghafooru alrraheemu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Tell My servants that I alone am the Forgiving, the Merciful One,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Tell My servants that I am indeed the Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful;

verses.text: وَ أَنَ‌ عَذَابِي‌ هُوَ الْعَذَابُ‌ الْأَلِيمُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اینکه عذابم [برای مجرمان] همان عذاب دردناک است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و عذاب من عذابى دردآور است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اين كه عذاب من عذابى دردآور است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اينكه عذاب من، عذابى است دردناك.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و نیز عذاب من بسیار سخت و دردناک است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و این که عذاب من (در حق سرکشان بی‌ایمان) عذاب بسیار دردناکی است (و عذابهای دیگر در برابرش عذاب نیست). [[«الألِیمُ»: بسیار دردآور و دردناک.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و [در جای خود] عذاب من هم عذابی دردناک است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و (اینکه) عذاب و کیفر من، همان عذاب دردناک است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و آنکه عذاب من است آن عذاب دردناک‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اينكه عذاب من عذاب دردناك است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اینکه بی‌گمان عذاب من، آن عذاب دردناک است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But My punishment is surely a painful one.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And that indeed the punishment of Mine is a painful punishment.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and that My chastisement is the painful chastisement.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily My torment! that is the torment afflictive

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And that My Torment is indeed the most painful torment.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And that My punishment is the painful punishment.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: At the same time, My chastisement is highly painful.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And that My torment is indeed the most painful torment.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And that My doom is the dolorous doom.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and that My punishment is a painful punishment.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and that My punishment is the painful chastisement.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And that it is My punishment which is the painful punishment.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and that My punishment is a painful one.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And that My punishment-- that is the painful punishment.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wa anna AAathabee huwa alAAathabu alaleemu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and that My punishment is a painful punishment.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And that My Penalty will be indeed the most grievous Penalty.

verses.text: وَ نَبِّئْهُمْ‌ عَنْ‌ ضَيْفِ‌ إِبْرَاهِيمَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و نیز آنان را از مهمانان ابراهیم خبر ده.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و از مهمانان ابراهيم خبر دارشان كن.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آنها را از مهمانان ابراهيم خبر كن

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و از مهمانان ابراهيم به آنان خبر ده،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هم بندگانم را از حکایت (فرشتگان) مهمانان ابراهیم آگاه ساز.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و آنان را باخبر کن از مهمانان ابراهیم (که فرشتگانی بودند و در لباس انسانها به پیش او آمدند). [[«ضَیْفِ»: مهمانان. مصدر است و در اینجا به معنی ضیوف استعمال شده است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به آنان از مهما[نا]ن ابراهیم خبر ده‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و به آنها از مهمانهای ابراهیم خبر ده!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و آگهیشان ده از میهمانان ابراهیم‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنان را از مهمانان ابراهيم خبر ده.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و از میهمانان ابراهیم به آنان خبری مهم بده.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Inform them about the matter of Abraham's guests.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And inform them of Ibrahim’s guests.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And tell them of the guests of Abraham,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And declare thou unto them of Ibrahim's guests.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And tell them about the guests (the angels) of Ibrahim (Abraham).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And inform them of the guests of Abraham.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And tell them about Abraham's guests.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And tell them about the guests (i.e., the angels) of Ibrahim.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And tell them of Abraham's guests,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Tell them of Abraham's guests.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Tell them about the guests of Abraham

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And inform them of the guests of Ibrahim:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wanabbihum AAan dayfi ibraheema

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Tell them about Abraham's guests:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Tell them about the guests of Abraham.

verses.text: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ‌ فَقَالُوا سَلاَماً قَالَ‌ إِنَّا مِنْکُمْ‌ وَجِلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: هنگامی که بر او وارد شدند، پس سلام گفتند. [ابراهیم] گفت: ما از شما ترسانیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنگاه كه بر او داخل شدند و گفتند: سلام. ابراهيم گفت: ما از شما مى‌ترسيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: هنگامى كه بر او وارد شدند و سلام گفتند. گفت: همانا ما از شما بيمناكيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: هنگامى كه بر او وارد شدند و سلام گفتند. [ابراهيم‌] گفت: «ما از شما بيمناكيم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که چون آن مهمانان بر ابراهیم وارد شدند و بر او سلام دادند ابراهیم (مضطرب شده) گفت: ما از شما (که بدون اذن و بی‌موقع بر ما در آمدید) بیمناکیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: زمانی (را بیان کن) که به پیش او آمدند و گفتند: درود! ابراهیم گفت: ما از شما می‌ترسیم! [[«سَلاماً»: درودتان باد! مترسید و آرام باشید. مفعول مطلق یا صفت مصدر محذوفی است. تقدیر چنین است: سَلِّمُوا سَلاماً. قالُوا قَوْلاً سَلاماً. «وَجِلُونَ»: بیمناکان. ترسندگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: هنگامی که [فرشتگان‌] بر او وارد شدند و سلام گفتند، گفت ما از شما هراسانیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که بر او وارد شدند و سلام کردند؛ (ابراهیم) گفت: «ما از شما بیمناکیم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هنگامی که درآمدند بر او پس گفتند سلامی گفت همانا مائیم از شما هراسان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنگاه كه بر او در آمدند و سلام گفتند. [ابراهيم‌] گفت: ما از شما هراسانيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: چون بر او وارد شدند پس (بدو) سلام گفتند. (ابراهیم) گفت: «ما از شما بیمناکیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When they came to him and said: "Peace," he answered: "Truly we are afraid of you."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: When the angels came to him and said, “Peace"; he said, “We feel afraid of you.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: when they entered unto him, saying, 'Peace!' He said, 'Behold, we are afraid of you.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: When they entered unto him, and said; peace! He said: verily we are afraid of you.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: When they entered unto him, and said: Salaman (peace)! [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Indeed! We are afraid of you."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When they entered upon him, and said, “Peace.” He said, “We are wary of you.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: When they came to Abraham they said: "Peace be upon you!" He replied: "Indeed we feel afraid of you."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: When they entered upon him, and said: "Salaman (peace!)." He said: "Indeed we are frightened of you."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (How) when they came in unto him, and said: Peace. He said: Lo! we are afraid of you.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: when they entered into his presence and said, ‘Peace!’ He said, ‘We are indeed afraid of you.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They entered to him and said: 'Peace' but he replied: 'We are afraid of you'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." [Abraham] said, "Indeed, we are fearful of you."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: who came to him saying, "Peace be with you." Abraham said, "We are afraid of you".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: When they entered upon him, they said, Peace. He said: Surely we are afraid of you.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ith dakhaloo AAalayhi faqaloo salaman qala inna minkum wajiloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: when they came to him they greeted him with: "Peace." He said,"We feel afraid of you."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: When they entered his presence and said, "Peace!" He said, "We feel afraid of you!"

verses.text: قَالُوا لاَ تَوْجَلْ‌ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُکَ‌ بِغُلاَمٍ‌ عَلِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفتند: نترس که ما تو را به پسری دانا مژده می دهیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: مترس، ما تو را به پسرى دانا بشارت مى‌دهيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفتند: مترس كه ما تو را به پسرى دانا مژده مى‌دهيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفتند: «مترس، كه ما تو را به پسرى دانا مژده مى‌دهيم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: فرشتگان گفتند: هیچ مترس که ما آمده‌ایم تو را به پسری دانا بشارت دهیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفتند: مترس! ما تو را به پسر بسیار دانائی مژده می‌دهیم. [[«لا تَوْجَلْ»: هراسناک مباش. «غُلامٍ»: پسر. در اینجا مراد اسحاق است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفتند مترس ما تو را به فرزندی دانا بشارت می‌دهیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفتند: «نترس، ما تو را به پسری دانا بشارت می‌دهیم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند بیم مدار همانا نویدیت دهیم به فرزندی دانا

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفتند: مترس، ما تو را به پسرى دانا مژده مى‌دهيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفتند: «مترس، که ما تو را به پسری بس دانا مژده می‌دهیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "Have no fear," they said. "We bring you news of a son full of wisdom."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They said, “Do not fear – we convey to you the glad tidings of a knowledgeable boy.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They said, 'Be not afraid; behold, we give thee good tidings of a cunning boy.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They said: be not afraid; verily we bear thou the glad tidings of a boy knowing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They (the angels) said: "Do not be afraid! We give you glad tidings of a boy (son) possessing much knowledge and wisdom."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They said, “Do not fear; we bring you good news of a boy endowed with knowledge.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They said: "Do not feel afraid, for we give you the good news of a wise boy."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They said: "Do not be afraid! We bring you the good news of a boy possessing much knowledge and wisdom."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They said: Be not afraid! Lo! we bring thee good tidings of a boy possessing wisdom.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They said, ‘Do not be afraid. Indeed we give you the good news of a wise son.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Do not be afraid' they answered. 'We come to give you glad tidings of a knowledgeable child'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [The angels] said, "Fear not. Indeed, we give you good tidings of a learned boy."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They replied, "Do not be afraid. We have brought you the glad news of (the birth) of a learned son".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They said: Be not afraid, surely we give you the good news of a boy, possessing knowledge.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo la tawjal inna nubashshiruka bighulamin AAaleemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They said, "Do not be afraid. We come to you with good news. You shall have a son who shall be endowed with great knowledge."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They said: "Fear not! We give thee glad tidings of a son endowed with wisdom."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ أَ بَشَّرْتُمُونِي‌ عَلَى‌ أَنْ‌ مَسَّنِيَ‌ الْکِبَرُ فَبِمَ‌ تُبَشِّرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: آیا با آنکه پیری به من رسید، مژده ام می دهید؟ به چه مژده می دهید؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: آيا مرا بشارت مى‌دهيد با آنكه پير شده‌ام؟ به چه چيز بشارتم مى‌دهيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: آيا با اين كه مرا پيرى فرا رسيده است بشارتم مى‌دهيد؟ به چه بشارت مى‌دهيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «آيا با اينكه مرا پيرى فرا رسيده است بشارتم مى‌دهيد؟ به چه بشارت مى‌دهيد؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ابراهیم گفت: آیا مرا در این سن پیری مژده فرزند می‌دهید؟ نشانه این مژده چیست؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ابراهیم) گفت: آیا چنین مژده‌ای را به من می‌دهید در حالی که پیری گریبانگیر من شده است؟ پس چگونه (و برابر کدام قاعده در چنین سنّ و سالی به تولّد فرزند مرا) مژده می‌دهید؟! [[«عَلَی»: به معنی (مَعَ)، یعنی: با این که. «الْکِبَرُ»: کهولت و پیری. «عَلَی أَن مَّسَّنِیَ الْکِبَرُ»: جملیه حالیّه است برای ضمیر (ی) در (بَشَّرْتُمُونِی). «بِمَ»: به کدام قاعده و قانون؟ چگونه و به چه شکل؟]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت با وجود اینکه پیری من بالا گرفته است به من بشارت می‌دهید، چگونه بشارتی به من می‌دهید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «آیا به من (چنین) بشارت می‌دهید با اینکه پیر شده‌ام؟! به چه چیز بشارت می‌دهید؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت آیا نوید دهیدم با آنکه مرا رسیده است پیری پس به چه نویدم دهید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: آيا مرا با آنكه پيرى به من رسيده مژده مى‌دهيد؟ به چه چيز مژده مى‌دهيد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «آیا بر حال سالخورد‌گی‌ا‌م بشارت دادید؟ پس به چه مرا بشارت می‌دهید؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "You bring me the good news now," he said, "when old age has come upon me. What good news are you giving me then?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “Do you convey to me the glad tidings upon old age reaching me? So upon what do you convey glad tidings?” (* Prophet Ibrahim said this out of surprise.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'What, do you give me good tidings, though old age has smitten me? Of what do you

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: bear ye me glad tidings when old age hath touched me? of what then ye bear me glad tidings?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Do you give me glad tidings (of a son) when old age has overtaken me? Of what then is your news?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “Do you bring me good news, when old age has overtaken me? What good news do you bring?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Abraham said: "What, do you give me this tiding though old age has smitten me? Just consider what tiding do you give me!"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "Do you give me this good news while old age has overtaken me Of what then is your news about"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Bring ye me good tidings (of a son) when old age hath overtaken me? Of what then can ye bring good tidings?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Do you give me good news though old age has befallen me? What is the good news that you bring me?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He said: 'What is this, do you bring me glad tidings even though I am old' Of what do you give me glad tidings'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He said, "Have you given me good tidings although old age has come upon me? Then of what [wonder] do you inform?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Abraham asked, "Are you giving me the glad news of a son in my old age? What reason can you give for such glad news?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: Do you give me good news (of a son) when old age has come upon me?-- Of what then do you give me good news!

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala abashshartumoonee AAala an massaniya alkibaru fabima tubashshirooni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He said, "Do you bring me such news despite my old age? What kind of good news are you bringing me?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He said: "Do ye give me glad tidings that old age has seized me? Of what, then, is your good news?"

verses.text: قَالُوا بَشَّرْنَاکَ‌ بِالْحَقِ‌ فَلاَ تَکُنْ‌ مِنَ‌ الْقَانِطِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفتند: تو را به بشارتی درست و به حق [که واقع شدنی است] مژده دادیم؛ بنابراین از ناامیدان مباش.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: به حق بشارتت داديم، از نوميدان مباش.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفتند: ما تو را به حق بشارت داديم، پس از نوميدان مباش

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفتند: «ما تو را به حق بشارت داديم. پس، از نوميدان مباش.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: گفتند: ما تو را به حق و حقیقت بشارت دادیم و تو هرگز نومید مباش.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفتند: ما تو را به چیز راست و درستی مژده داده‌ایم و از زمره‌ی مأیوسان (از رحمت خدا) مباش. [[«بِالْحَقِّ»: به چیز راست و درستی. به کار محقّق و مطمئنّی. به طریقه و شیوه‌ای که حق است و آن خرق عادت توسّط قادر مطلق است. «الْقَانِطِینَ»: افراد مأیوس و ناامید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفتند ما به راستی و درستی به تو بشارت می‌دهیم، از نومیدان مباش‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفتند: «تو را به حق بشارت دادیم؛ از مأیوسان مباش!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند بشارت آوردیمت به حقّ پس نباش از نومیدان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفتند: تو را درست مژده داديم، پس از نوميدان مباش.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفتند: «ما تو را به حق بشارت دادیم. پس از نومیدان مباش.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "We have given you the happy tidings of a truth," they replied. "So do not be one of those who despair."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They said, “We have given you true tidings, therefore do not lose hope.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: give me good tidings?' They said, 'We give thee good tidings of truth. Be not of those that despair.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They said: we bear tidings of a truth; be then thou not of the desponding.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They (the angels) said: "We give you glad tidings in truth. So be not of the despairing ones."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They said, “We bring you good news in truth, so do not despair.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They said: "The good tiding we give you is of truth. Do not, therefore, be of those who despair."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They said: "We give you good news in truth. So do not be of those who despair."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They said: We bring thee good tidings in truth. So be not thou of the despairing.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They said, ‘We bring you good news in truth; so do not be despondent.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They replied: 'In truth we have given you glad tidings, do not be one of those who despair'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They said, "We have given you good tidings in truth, so do not be of the despairing."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They said, "We have given you the glad news for a true reason so do not despair".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They said: We give you good news with truth, therefore be not of the despairing.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo bashsharnaka bialhaqqi fala takun mina alqaniteena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They said, "We have, indeed, given you glad tidings in truth; do not therefore despair."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They said: "We give thee glad tidings in truth: be not then in despair!"

verses.text: قَالَ‌ وَ مَنْ‌ يَقْنَطُ مِنْ‌ رَحْمَةِ رَبِّهِ‌ إِلاَّ الضَّالُّونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: چه کسی جز گمراهان از رحمت پروردگارش ناامید می شود؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: جز گمراهان چه كسى از رحمت پروردگارش نوميد مى‌شود؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: چه كسى جز گمراهان، از رحمت پروردگارش نوميد مى‌شود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «چه كسى -جز گمراهان- از رحمت پروردگارش نوميد مى‌شود؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ابراهیم گفت: به جز مردم گمراه چه کسی از لطف خدای خود نومید می‌شود؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفت: چه کسی است که از رحمت پروردگارش مأیوس شود، مگر گمراهان (بی‌خبر از قدرت و عظمت خدا؟!). [[«مَن یَقْنَطُ»: چه کسی ناامید می‌گردد؟! استفهام انکاری است، یعنی کسی ناامید نمی‌گردد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت و جز گمراهان کسی از رحمت پروردگارش نومید نمی‌شود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «جز گمراهان، چه کسی از رحمت پروردگارش مأیوس می‌شود؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت کیست که نومید شود از رحمت پروردگار خویش مگر گمراهان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: جز گمراهان چه كسى از رحمت پروردگار خويش نوميد مى‌شود؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «و چه کسانی - جز گمراهان‌- از رحمت پروردگارشان نومید می‌شوند؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "Who would despair of the mercy of his Lord," he answered, "but those who go astray."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “Who is it that despairs from the mercy of his Lord, except those who are astray?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, excepting those that are astray?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: and who despondeth of the mercy of his Lord except the astray

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "And who despairs of the Mercy of his Lord except those who are astray?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “And who despairs of his Lord’s mercy but the lost?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Abraham said: "Who despairs of the Mercy of his Lord except the misguided?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except those who are astray"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: And who despaireth of the mercy of his Lord save those who are astray?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Who despairs of his Lord’s mercy except the astray?!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He replied: 'And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, except those that are astray?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He said, "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except for those astray?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He said, "No one despairs of the mercy of his Lord except those who are in error.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord but the erring ones?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala waman yaqnatu min rahmati rabbihi illa alddalloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He said, "Who but the misguided despair of the mercy of their Lord?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He said: "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, but such as go astray?"

verses.text: قَالَ‌ فَمَا خَطْبُکُمْ‌ أَيُّهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [سپس] گفت: ای فرستادگان! کار مهم شما چیست؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: اى رسولان، كار شما چيست؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: اى فرستادگان! پس كار شما چيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [سپس‌] گفت: «اى فرشتگان، [ديگر] كارتان چيست؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن گاه ابراهیم پرسش کرد که ای رسولان حق، باز گویید که بر چه کار مبعوث شده‌اید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ابراهیم پس از الفت با فرشتگان و یقین از مژده، بدیشان) گفت: ای فرستادگان! بگوئید چه کار مهمّی (غیر از این بشارت) دارید؟ [[«خَطْبُ»: کار مهمّی که قابل گفتگو است (نگا: یوسف / 51).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت ای فرشتگان حال، کار و بار شما چیست؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (سپس) گفت: «مأموریت شما چیست ای فرستادگان خدا؟»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت پس چیست کار شما ای فرستادگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: اى فرستادگان، كار شما چيست؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «ای فرستادگان، پس جریان مهم‌تان چیست‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And asked them: "What matter, O angels, brings you here?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “And what is your next task, O the sent angels?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'And what is your business, envoys?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: what is your errand, sent ones?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham) again] said: "What then is the business on which you have come, O Messengers?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “So what is your business, O envoys?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He added: "What is your errand O sent ones?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "What then is the business for which you have come, O messengers"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: And afterward what is your business, O ye messengers (of Allah)?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘O messengers, what is now your errand?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He asked: 'Messengers, what is your errand'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Messengers, what is your task?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: What is your business then, O apostles?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala fama khatbukum ayyuha almursaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then he asked, "What then is your business, O messengers?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Abraham said: "What then is the business on which ye (have come), O ye messengers (of Allah)?"

verses.text: قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَى‌ قَوْمٍ‌ مُجْرِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفتند: ما به سوی قومی گنهکار فرستاده شده ایم [تا نابودشان کنیم.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: ما بر سر مردمى گنهكار فرستاده شده‌ايم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفتند: ما به سوى مردمى گناهكار فرستاده شده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفتند: «ما به سوى گروه مجرمان فرستاده شده‌ايم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: فرشتگان پاسخ دادند که ما بر هلاک قومی زشتکار فرستاده شده‌ایم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفتند: ما به سوی قوم گناهکاری فرستاده شده‌ایم (و همگان را نابود می‌کنیم). [[«قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِینَ»: قوم بزهکاری. مراد قوم لوط است و نکره‌آمدن و توصیف به گناهکاری برای خوار داشتن و نکوهش ایشان است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفتند ما به سروقت قومی گنهکار فرستاده شده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفتند: «ما به سوی قومی گنهکار مأموریت یافته‌ایم (تا آنها را هلاک کنیم)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند همانا فرستاده شدیم بسوی قومی گنهکار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفتند: ما به سوى گروهى بزهكار فرستاده شده‌ايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفتند: «ما بی‌گمان سوی گروهی مجرمان فرستاده شده‌ایم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "We have been sent," they said, "to (punish) a sinful people,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They said, “We have been sent towards a guilty nation.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They said, 'We have been sent unto a people of sinners,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They said: verily we have been sent unto a people guilty-

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They (the angels) said: "We have been sent to a people who are Mujrimun (criminals, disbelievers, polytheists, sinners).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They said, “We were sent to a sinful people.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They said: "Verily we have been sent to a guilty people

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They said: "We have been sent to a guilty people."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They said: We have been sent unto a guilty folk,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They said, ‘We have been sent toward a guilty people,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They replied: 'We are sent to sinful nation.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They said, "We are sent to a sinful people.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They said: Surely we are sent towards a guilty people,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo inna orsilna ila qawmin mujrimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They said, "We have been sent forth to a guilty people."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They said: "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin,

verses.text: إِلاَّ آلَ‌ لُوطٍ إِنَّا لَمُنَجُّوهُمْ‌ أَجْمَعِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مگر خاندان لوط را که قطعاً همه آنان را نجات می دهیم،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر خاندان لوط، كه همه را نجات مى‌دهيم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر خاندان لوط كه ما قطعا همه آنها را نجات مى‌دهيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مگر خانواده لوط، كه ما قطعاً همه آنان را نجات مى‌دهيم،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (که آن قوم مجرم لوطند که به جرم عمل بد هلاک شوند) مگر اهل بیت لوط که همه آنها را از بلا نجات خواهیم داد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مگر خانواده‌ی لوط را که همه‌ی اعضاء خانواده را نجات می‌دهیم. [[«إِلآّ آلَ لُوطٍ»: مستثنی می‌تواند متّصل باشد و معنی چنین می‌شود: ما به سوی قوم گناهکاری فرستاده شده‌ایم، مگر خانواده لوط که در میان آنان گناهکار نیست. یا منقطع باشد که معنی آن در بالا گذشت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: غیر از آل لوط که ما رهاننده همگی آنان هستیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مگر خاندان لوط، که همگی آنها را نجات خواهیم داد...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: مگر خاندان لوط که نجات دهنده‌ایم ایشان را همگی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر خاندان لوط، كه همگيشان را رهاننده‌ايم،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «مگر خانواده‌ی لوط (که) ما به‌راستی همگی آنان را بی‌چون نجات‌دهنده‌ایم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "Except the family of Lot whom we shall save

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Except the family of Lut; we shall rescue all of them.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: excepting the folk of Lot; them we shall deliver

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: All except the household of Lut; surely we are going to deliver all of them.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
